programme.title: Wildest Africa: Cape Coast: Where Worlds Colide
programme.desc: Watch Africa's Cape Coast that goes from the frigid waters of Cape Point to the sub-tropic seas of Kwazulu-Natal.

programme.title: Wildest Islands: Vancouver Island: Rivers of Life
programme.desc: Vancouver island is the largest island off the west coast of North America. Glaciers fuel the flow of some of Canada's tallest waterfalls, and an endless network of rivers and creeks provides the ideal habitat for the pacific salmon.

programme.title: Wildest Africa: Madagascar: Islands of Monsters
programme.desc: Madagascar is truly a weird and wonderful land. Isolated on an island of extreme and magical looking locations, life has adapted and diversified. With few predators, numbers have proliferated and natural selection has gone mad.

programme.title: Australia's Wild Places: The Red Desert
programme.desc: In this episode of Wild Places, we join botanist Peter Latz, who believes the biggest influence on the Australian arid landscape has been fire. Years ago, Peter wondered how different this country would have looked like without the influence of it.

programme.title: Wildest Indochina: Southwest China: China's Secret Garden
programme.desc: Tucked away in China's southwest corner is a hidden oasis unlike any other. Snow-capped mountains, temperate valleys and tropical jungles are home to a spectacular array of wildlife.

programme.title: Wildest Latin America: Pantanal: Brazil's Wild Heart
programme.desc: Every year the Pantanal is drowned by immense floods, and then suffer severe drought. Yet, while people struggle, the Pantanal hosts some of the greatest gatherings of animals on the planet.

programme.title: Wildest Africa: Ngorongoro: Born of Fire
programme.desc: Ngorongoro is thought to have formed about 2.5 million years ago from a large volcano, whose cone collapsed inward after a major eruption. This fertile land is full of wildlife, from cunning hyena and proud lions to vast herds of wildebeest and elephants.

programme.title: Wildest India: India's Lost World
programme.desc: North-east India is an anthropological paradise; there is no other place on Earth with so many different ethnic groups. The forest are filled with mysterious tribes whose lives are dictated by the rain and the seasonal fruits of the forest.

programme.title: Australia's Wild Places: The Rainforest
programme.desc: Daintree National Park is a magical meeting of rainforest and reef, lying at the heart of the world heritage listed wet tropics of Queensland.

programme.title: Wildest Africa: Okavango: Water in the Desert
programme.desc: The Okavango Delta, a huge emerald oasis in the burning heart of the Kalahari desert, is fed by the Okavango River and this perpetual cycle of wet and dry is the lifeblood of this extraordinary natural Eden.

programme.title: Wildest India: The Himalayas: Surviving the Summits
programme.desc: The Himalayas run across 2,500km of north India. he Himalayas' rugged highlands offer little direct refuge to humans, in the shadow below, over a billion people in India rely on the mountains for survival.

programme.title: Wildest Indochina: Thailand: The Wild Heart
programme.desc: Thailand is a land of extremes. A country shaped by wild forces, where animals face tough challenges to survive. Tropical rainforests, primeval caves, mangrove swamps, and rocky shorelines provide homes for remarkable creatures.

programme.title: Wildest Islands: Japan: Islands of Extremes
programme.desc: Japan's 7,000 islands stretch for over 2,400 km, and cover an incredible range of climates. Winter in the central and northern islands can be savage, but summer in the sweltering southern islands couldn't be more different.

programme.title: Australia's Wild Places: The Coast of the Whalesharks
programme.desc: On the remote coastline of Australia‚Äôs northwest, there are great natural wonders to be found. Above the sea on this sunbaked coast, there is very little; only a sparse landscape shaped by the arid conditions. But here, the miracle reveals itself‚Ä¶

programme.title: Wildest Islands: Falkland Islands: Penguin Paradise
programme.desc: The Falkland's bleak, battered, and windswept archipelago lies 460 km from the South American mainland. Rugged mountains and expansive pristine coastline are a unique home for wildlife ¬ñ especially for one of the world's most iconic flightless birds.

programme.title: Wildest Islands: Philippines: Islands of Mystery
programme.desc: The Philippines are a chain of around 7,000 tropical islands in the western Pacific.

programme.title: Wildest Latin America: Patagonia: The Ends of the Earth
programme.desc: Patagonia is a place of extremes ¬ñ of vast ice fields and snow-capped mountains; of windswept deserts, and violent oceans. Survival here means being tough enough to cope with brutal winters, and canny enough to exploit brief seasons of plenty.
programme.sub-title: Patagonia: The Ends of the Earth

programme.title: The Grudge
programme.desc: An American nurse living in Tokyo is exposed to a mysterious supernatural curse, one that locks a person in a powerful rage before claiming their life and spreading to another victim.

programme.title: The Last Witch Hunter
programme.desc: The last witch hunter (Vin Diesel) is all that stands between humanity and the combined forces of the most horrifying witches in history.

programme.title: Saw
programme.desc: Every puzzle has its pieces.

programme.title: The Sentinel
programme.desc: Compromised by his affair with the first lady, a veteran secret service agent is framed as a potential presidential assassin and must rely on a hostile former prot‚Äög‚Äö to flush out the real culprit.

programme.title: Cybermutt
programme.desc: The powerful dog Rex is injured by a car while rescuing a young scientist from being run over. Feeling responsible for the condition of Rex the scientist uses his skill as a prosthetics inventor to give the dog a new, super-power body.

programme.title: Love and Honor
programme.desc: While fighting in Vietnam, Dalton hears his girlfriend has dumped him so decides to fly to get her back. AWOL from the war zone, he has seven days to get back to the US, change his girlfriend's mind and make it back to Vietnam without anyone noticing

programme.title: Benji
programme.desc: Two school kids strike up a friendship with an orphaned puppy named Benji. When danger befalls them and they end up kidnapped by robbers who are in over their heads, Benji and his scruffy sidekick come to the rescue.

programme.title: Big Momma's House
programme.desc: In order to protect a woman from a robber, a male FBI agent disguises himself as an elderly woman.

programme.title: Cybermutt
programme.desc: The powerful dog Rex is injured by a car while rescuing a young scientist from being run over. Feeling responsible for the condition of Rex the scientist uses his skill as a prosthetics inventor to give the dog a new, super-power body.

programme.title: Hurricane Season
programme.desc: In the wake of Hurricane Katrina, high school basketball coach Al Collins assembles students from five different Louisiana schools and leads them all the way to the state championships.

programme.title: Untamed Youth
programme.desc: Joel invents a pipe with a smoke detector and a sprinkler system built in for the invention exchange. The guys watch a 1950s teen flick about youths sentenced to manual labor at a cotton farm.

programme.title: Beginning of the End
programme.desc: A swarm of giant grasshoppers, inadvertently created by a radioactive experiment, heads for Chicago.

programme.title: Lost Continent
programme.desc: A military team sent to search for a lost rocket ends up trapped on a mountain inhabited by dinosaurs in Lost Continent.

programme.title: Hamlet
programme.desc: A dour production of Shakespeare‚Äôs play produced for German TV. A prince returns home for his father‚Äôs funeral and doesn‚Äôt like what he finds.

programme.title: The Violent Years
programme.desc: Jam Handy shows the world the glory of sexism with electric kitchen appliances and Ed Wood analyzes the world of criminals spoiled by their parents.

programme.title: The Human Duplicators
programme.desc: An alien takes over a professor's mansion-basement laboratory, and makes android clones to infiltrate the government.

programme.title: Danger Death Ray
programme.desc: Danger Death Ray: A slick secret agent investigates an evil organization that stole a top secret death ray.

programme.title: MST3K: Werewolf
programme.desc: After digging up strange bones, a man becomes a werewolf.

programme.title: Swamp Diamonds
programme.desc: An undercover police woman infiltrates a group of hardened female criminals who plan to break out of prison and retrieve diamonds from a swamp.

programme.title: The Phantom Planet
programme.desc: When US astronaut Captain Frank Chapman‚Äôs military spaceship is damaged by asteroids, he lands safely on the giant asteroid Rheton.

programme.desc: Buttsquat's Teddy Bear washes up at Camp Lakebottom and hypnotizes the Bottom Dwellers.
programme.sub-title: Terror form the Toybox / Slimeball Run

programme.title: Camp Lakebottom: Pranks for Nothing / Zombie Dearest
programme.desc: Eager to regain his lost prank mojo, McGee releases a mischievous pixy named Hanky Pranky.

programme.title: Camp Lakebottom: Mc Crossroads / Lucky Duck
programme.desc: McGee signs a contract with Sheba the bandshee.

programme.title: Camp Lakebottom: Bird Brains / The Real Vincent
programme.desc: Squirt is eager to assist his idol, Dr. Sapstein on his latest quest for the rare mocker bird.

programme.title: Camp Lakebottom: Hiccups / Boogeyman Fever
programme.desc: Things start disappearing around Lakebottom!

programme.title: Camp Lakebottom: Clockwork Slime / Ride the Haunted Howler

programme.title: Camp Lakebottom: Lakebo-tron / Rise of the Dawn of the Beginning of the Planet of Armand!
programme.desc: McGee and Buttsquat go head-to-head in an 80's style arcade game! But as the points build up, the boys become digitized inside the game. The kids head back through the Lakebottom inter-dimensional portal, hoping to find a Sasquatch version of the camp.
programme.sub-title: Lakebo-tron / Rise of the Dawn of the Beginning of the Planet of Armand!

programme.title: Camp Lakebottom: Eclipsalypso / Apocalypse Squirt
programme.desc: McGee summons the Moon Dervish who will bring the Apocalypse unless a sasquatch dances for him.

programme.title: Camp Lakebottom: It's a Headless Horse, Man / Voyage to the Bottom of the Deep

programme.title: Camp Lakebottom: Escape from Lakebottom
programme.desc: McGee, Gretchen and Squirt arrive at Camp Lakebottom to find themselves held captive by a zombie.

programme.title: Camp Lakebottom: Butt-Squad / You Sank My Battle-Squirt!
programme.desc: Buttsquat steps in to help the bottomdwellers when they suddenly acquire the same red hair and freckles as their Sunny Smiles nemesis. When an alien invasion threatens Camp Lakebottom, the kids defend the camp against the alien mothership!

programme.title: Camp Lakebottom: Bite of the Buttsquat / Sword of Ittibiticus

programme.title: MythBusters: Episode 190
programme.desc: Can fireworks really launch a person over a lake? Can the weight of a bird be enough to tip a teetering car off of a cliff? Can a water heater turned on its side be used as a cannon?

programme.title: MythBusters: Episode 215
programme.desc: Can a room be painted using explosives via Adam's snowflake frame or Jamie's steel sphere? Can a boat be split in two by a channel marker?

programme.title: MythBusters: Episode 107
programme.desc: Myths tested: Can an airplane take off while on a conveyor belt? Can cockroaches, fruit flies and flour beetles survive extreme levels of radiation?

programme.title: MythBusters: Episode 68
programme.desc: Myths tested: Can a disposable lighter explode with lethal force? Are various gunslinger myths true?

programme.title: MythBusters: Episode 141
programme.desc: Can a person jump from a rooftop into a dumpster and walk away? Can a deep-sea diver's body be crushed into his helmet if his air hose breaks?

programme.title: MythBusters: Episode 173
programme.desc: Did the Syrians design a water-skimming torpedo as early as the 13th century? If a truckload of wine catches fire, will the bottles blow their corks 100 feet and sound like a machine gun?

programme.title: MythBusters: Episode 143
programme.desc: Can a cowboy shoot a gun out of a person's hand without injuring him? Is the 50-foot bus jump seen in "Speed" possible in real life?

programme.title: MythBusters: Episode 196
programme.desc: Should you really never bring a knife to a gunfight? Will you lose a sword fight if you try to strike first? Did the 14th-century Chinese design a two-stage, arrow-launching missile?

programme.title: MythBusters: Episode 122
programme.desc: Could a torture technique consisting of growing a bamboo through a victim's body have worked? Does dropping alkali metals in a water-filled bathtub result in a huge explosion?

programme.title: MythBusters: Episode 59
programme.desc: Myths tested: How easy is it to crack a safe? Can a hole be easily cut into a pane of glass without setting off a sound alarm?

programme.title: MythBusters: Episode 48
programme.desc: Myths tested: What caused a plane to be shredded? Can a fire be started by rubbing sticks together, with a bullet or with ice?

programme.title: MythBusters: Episode 206
programme.desc: Could a man sandwiched between two big men in the backseat of a car survive the car being T-boned by a truck, as seen in "Headhunters"?

programme.title: MythBusters: Episode 214
programme.desc: Is a bathroom's hand dryer better than a paper towel? Which public restroom stall is the cleanest? Is it better to stand in the doorway during an earthquake?

programme.title: MythBusters: Episode 82

programme.title: MythBusters: Episode 123
programme.desc: Can a car bumper explode? Did Hungarian archers get twice the penetration shooting a bow from a galloping horse?

programme.title: MythBusters: Episode 45

programme.title: Deadly Women: Lethal Love
programme.desc: Love is a powerful emotion, one that sits in the core of our soul and fills our lives with hope. But when love turns sour, the results can be deadly. In an act of revenge, these deadly women unite with one common goal, to kill.

programme.title: Deadly Women: Senseless Slayings
programme.desc: When a person places no value on human life, they can become unstoppable in their twisted missions to destroy the lives around them. These women all pushed boundaries, and shattered lives with their actions.

programme.title: Deadly Women: Greed
programme.desc: Known as ‚Äúblack widows,‚Äù these women kill their spouses, lovers and children for profit. Murder for them becomes a business. Their trade is murder. Their profit? Blood money.

programme.title: Deadly Women: To Love and to Murder
programme.desc: Marriage is a lifelong commitment of love, and wedding vows. 'To have and to hold; for better, for worse; until death do us part'. But for these monstrous wives, it was only the vow of 'death do us part' they upheld.

programme.title: Deadly Women: Sins of the Sister
programme.desc: A sisterly bond can mean a life full of friendship and sibling love. But for some women, having a sister means nothing more then having their own personal meal ticket, scapegoat and combatant. These types of relationships can lead to deadly outcomes.

programme.title: Deadly Women
programme.desc: Love and desire are powerful currents that surge through human affairs. When they run off course, the results can be deadly.

programme.title: Deadly Women: Breaking Point
programme.desc: Anger, fear and despair are basic human emotions. But when these emotions are coupled with a broken mind, a perfect storm is created. Teetering on the edge of unbalance, these women resort to murder when pushed to the breaking point.

programme.title: Deadly Women: A Daughter's Revenge
programme.desc: Every day, teenage girls are being scolded by their parents, only to respond with tears and slammed bedroom doors. Some daughters won‚Äôt take "no" for an answer, and these girls become deadly.

programme.title: Deadly Women
programme.desc: Sometimes, when a man and a woman unite, a terrible urge for destruction can awaken in them both. Happy couples become deadly teams, intent on one goal: murder.

programme.title: Deadly Women
programme.desc: Psychopathic killers lurk in society, mostly acting alone. Sometimes fate brings them into contact with another person who shares their cold power to kill.

programme.title: Deadly Women
programme.desc: Blood ties are strong ties, sometimes strong enough to pull a person into a murderous conspiracy. When a family member wields his or her power, the result can be death.

programme.title: Deadly Women
programme.desc: The heaviest judgments of convicted killers are reserved for those who committed premeditated murder. These women plot and plan. They know the consequences of their actions, but still they go forward to kill.

programme.title: Deadly Women
programme.desc: These women never get their hands dirty: no blood touched them because they manipulate others to kill for them...but they didn't get away.

programme.title: Deadly Women
programme.desc: Behind lace-curtained windows and beneath sensible haircuts lurked evil. Appearances were deceptive. We did not notice these female killers walking by. These women wore a mask of sanity.

programme.title: Deadly Women
programme.desc: We want to believe that all women would give their lives to protect their children. But there are horrifying cases when a mother will turn against her natural instinct and kill her own flesh and blood.

programme.title: Deadly Women
programme.desc: The path towards revenge can sometimes lead to murder. It can be quick, fiery and violent. It can also be a dish served cold, the product of a calm, calculated plot.

programme.title: Deadly Women
programme.desc: A lovely lady with an innocent smile, kind eyes, a charming personality? No one would suspect a woman like that would murder. These women don‚Äôt look or behave like killers.

programme.title: Deadly Women
programme.desc: No one doubts a woman‚Äôs capacity to love, but sometimes lust can turn lethal. In the ultimate fatal attraction, "Deadly Women" looks at cases of murder driven by obsessive love.

programme.title: Deadly Women: Under His Control
programme.desc: These are love stories with bleak, bloody endings. Blinded by desire, obsessed and malleable, some women fall into lethal relationships with dangerous, controlling men.

programme.title: The FBI Files: Deadly Threat
programme.desc: A suspected drug dealer would stop at nothing to keep local and federal authorities from building a case against him. When his organization started targeting the government itself, federal agencies went on high alert.

programme.title: The FBI Files: Without Remorse
programme.desc: A small town without any crime was turned inside out by the arrival of one dangerous stranger. Some killers are cold and calculating; others are impulsive, unpredictable, and hard to pin down.

programme.title: The FBI Files: Dishonored
programme.desc: Shirley Russell was determined enough to reach the rank of Captain in the United States Marine Corps. When this officer turned up missing, her colleagues refused to believe she had gone AWOL. It was unclear whether Captain Shirley Russell was alive.

programme.title: The FBI Files: The Killing Zone
programme.desc: In the 1990's the war on drugs was in full swing. The front lines were often America's inner cities where gangs use violence and murder to rule their empires.

programme.title: The FBI Files: Crime Spree
programme.desc: They swept through six states like a plague, thrill killers acting without rhyme or reason. They targeted adults and young girls, kidnapping, and murdering. And in their rampage, they left plenty of clues, but moving targets are the hardest to hit.

programme.title: The FBI Files: The World Trade Center Bombing
programme.desc: Terrorist bombings are what happen in other countries. Not here in the United States. And yet, in 1993, it happened in New York City.

programme.title: The FBI Files: Human Prey
programme.desc: Thomas Dillon killed five outdoorsmen at random over a period of three years in rural southern Ohio. After a tip led the FBI to the murder weapon, ballistic testing made a match.

programme.title: The FBI Files: The C-11 Squad
programme.desc: New York City is not stranger to gang violence. But when a 12-year-old child was kidnapped, the gangs had crossed a line. Law enforcement raced to find the missing boy before it was too late.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A daring kidnapping and a bizarre ransom note baffled Mississippi authorities. The victim was the wife of a wealthy businessman. A list of 12 names and a few drops of blood were the only clues to her fate.

programme.title: The FBI Files: Deadly Business
programme.desc: Many escape the poverty of India to start new lives in the United States. One turned the American dream into a nightmare. People started turning up dead in New York's Indian community-authorities struggled to link fraud and murder to a powerful man.

programme.title: The FBI Files: Blood Brothers
programme.desc: When the small community of Noel, Missouri discovered their bank was robbed, they're shocked. When the bank president turned up missing, they're outraged. And when clues began to surface the facts were more terrible than anyone could have guessed.

programme.title: The FBI Files: The Murdering Cowboy
programme.desc: The sun set on the Wild West long ago, but some people refused to notice. Claude Dallas was one of them. A wily trapper, Dallas typified the rugged individualism that forged this country. He went too far when he killed two game wardens in 1981.

programme.title: The FBI Files: The Predator
programme.desc: In the early 1990's, Washington, D.C., became the murder capital of the nation. Few were left untouched by gang violence, which was ignited by the drug trade. By 1994, that violence would strike at the very heart of law enforcement.

programme.title: The FBI Files: Dead Run
programme.desc: In Pennsylvania, an inmate escaped with the help of his female accomplice. Following a trail of fraudulent credit card receipts and deaths, authorities track the pair, but always find themselves one step behind.

programme.title: The FBI Files: Deadly Stranger
programme.desc: The body of a young woman found burned in a truck launched a manhunt to find her killer. When more bodies began to turn up across the country, the FBI believed the cases were linked. Investigators had a suspect. They just couldn't find him.

programme.title: The FBI Files: Small Town Terror
programme.desc: In a small Ohio community, an elderly woman and a teenaged boy disappeared. Because they vanished within hours of each other, police believed the cases were linked. But they didn't know how.

programme.title: Worzel Gummidge Down Under
programme.desc: The Travelling Scarecrow Maker seeks his revenge by kidnapping Worzel and transforming him into a Slave Scarecrow. With Aunt Sally next in his sights, can his evil plan be thwarted?

programme.title: Worzel Gummidge Down Under
programme.desc: The Crowman recruits a reluctant Aunt Sally to rescue the enchanted Worzel. The task requires her to be a master of disguise to outwit the Travelling Scarecrow Maker - is she up to the challenge?

programme.title: Worzel Gummidge Down Under
programme.desc: Worzel makes preparations for his Birthday Tea Dance. However, he soon discovers the guest list may prove distinctly lacking in attendees. Can The Crowman, Mickey and Manu come to the rescue?

programme.title: Worzel Gummidge Down Under
programme.desc: Worzel's continuing efforts to win over Aunt Sally encounter a new obstacle when the Provincial Travelling Ballet troupe arrives in town.

programme.title: Worzel Gummidge Down Under
programme.desc: An impoverished Crowman is pursued by the bailiffs. Mickey and Manu decide to help but Worzel's efforts leave him stuck in an abandoned mine and, with the Crowman now retired, how will he escape?

programme.title: Worzel Gummidge Down Under
programme.desc: Mickey, Manu and The Crowman prepare a funeral for the missing Worzel. The unfortunate scarecrow is still in the clutches of the Prospector who is finding him to be a less than helpful assistant.

programme.title: Worzel Gummidge Down Under
programme.desc: When Aunt Sally sees a poster for a beauty contest, she goes shopping for a posh dress, a 'tiararara' and a makeover. Alas, the beauty contest isn't all that it seemed.

programme.title: Worzel Gummidge Down Under
programme.desc: The Crowman has a new scarecrow who he assigns to Worzel to show him the ropes. Unfortunately, the new recruit proves to be rather reluctant which only gets worse when the crop sprayers arrive.

programme.title: Worzel Gummidge Down Under
programme.desc: When one of The Crowman's previous creations returns to visit his maker, Worzel develops a nasty case of the green-eyed monster - which only gets worse when Weevily Swede meets his Aunt Sally.

programme.title: Worzel Gummidge Down Under
programme.desc: Aunt Sally's greedy dreams of wealth lead Worzel, Mickey and Manu into trouble once more when she helps a waxwork pirate escape from a funfair side-show, in search of his long-buried treasure.

programme.title: Worzel Gummidge Down Under
programme.desc: After joining the Crowman at an art show, Aunt Sally is taken with the riches on offer for sale of a truly great work. Worzel, also, seeks fame and fortune - and intends to prove his own artistic talents accordingly.

programme.title: Worzel Gummidge Down Under
programme.desc: Worzel and Blighty are sent away as punishment, travelling by train. After seeing members of the crew breaking for tea and cake, their attempts to get some for themselves see the train leaving the station with no staff on board!

programme.title: Worzel Gummidge Down Under
programme.desc: After joining the Crowman at an art show, Aunt Sally is taken with the riches on offer for sale of a truly great work. Worzel, also, seeks fame and fortune - and intends to prove his own artistic talents accordingly.

programme.title: Worzel Gummidge Down Under
programme.desc: A nearby convent presents the Crowman with a challenge: the commission of his first female scarecrow.

programme.title: Worzel Gummidge Down Under
programme.desc: New Zealand's governor general requires a scarecrow to prevent the eating of his beautiful lawns,so the crowman summons all of his greatest creations to assess who is best for the job.

programme.title: Happy Days: Not With My Sister You Don't
programme.desc: Richie's surprise over little sister Joanie's first real date turns to shock when he learns it's with Spike, a pint-sized replica of his Uncle Fonzie.
programme.sub-title: Not With My Sister You Don't

programme.title: Happy Days: Richie Moves Out
programme.desc: Hoping for more privacy, Richie moves out of the Cunningham home to share an apartment with his brother and soon discovers it's not the paradise he expected.

programme.title: Happy Days: You Go To My Head
programme.desc: Richie's fears get the best of him while he's reading a book on abnormal psychology and it drives him to secretly see a psychiatrist.

programme.title: Happy Days: The Cunningham Caper
programme.desc: Richie is sick in bed with the flu and is bored with eating soup and doing crossword puzzles. But when his family leaves him alone in the house, pandemonium breaks loose when Fonzie, Potsie, Ralph, and a burglar join him.

programme.title: Happy Days: The Apartment
programme.desc: Personality quirks begin to fray nerves after best friends Richie, Ralph, and Potsie rent an apartment together.

programme.title: Happy Days: Hard Cover
programme.desc: Richie and Fonzie must think fast to outwit a tough housemother after they're caught past curfew in the college girls' dormitory.

programme.title: Happy Days: Hollywood Part 2
programme.desc: Soon after getting the bad news that the studio deemed his James Dean impression obsolete, and gave Richie's wholesome good looks a contract instead, the Fonz finds a bigger fish to fry.

programme.title: Happy Days: Hollywood Part 3
programme.desc: Richie must choose either a 5-year Hollywood contract or college in Milwaukee while the Fonz accepts the California Kid's challenge to perform a dangerous water ski jump...over a shark!

programme.title: Happy Days: Fonsilectomy
programme.desc: Forced to spend the night in the hospital's children's ward, Fonzie worries more about who will be making time with his girl at the Halloween party than the tonsillectomy he's scheduled for the next morning.

programme.title: Happy Days: My Cousin the Cheat
programme.desc: Fonzie is furious with his rebellious cousin, Chachi Arcola, after Chachi cheats on a school test using answers stolen from a tutoring session with Joanie Cunningham.

programme.title: Happy Days: My Fair Fonzie
programme.desc: Snobby Cynthia Holmes schemes with her obnoxious cousin, Skippy, to make the Fonz look foolish at a country club soir√©e.

programme.title: Happy Days: Bye Bye Blackball
programme.desc: Richie, Ralph, and Potsie endure the harassment of "hell week" to prove themselves worthy to enter their college fraternity, Phi Kappa Nu.

programme.title: Happy Days: Richie Almost Dies
programme.desc: What begins as a humorous escapade with a motorcycle turns into a tragic vigil for the Cunninghams and their friends.

programme.title: Happy Days: Do You Want to Dance
programme.desc: Fonzie's latest romantic interest, a ballet teacher, is secretly yearning to turn professional and dance with the greats in New York. Fonzie, however, has trouble accepting that she may forgo their relationship to pursue her dreams of fame.

programme.title: Happy Days: Fearless Malph
programme.desc: When Ralph Malph is hypnotized to cure his fright after a tornado warning is posted, Ralph's loss of fear causes him to tempt fate by suggesting that the Fonz needs training wheels for his stupid motorcycle

programme.title: Happy Days: Smokin' Ain'T Cool
programme.desc: Joanie believes she has to smoke to fit in with the cool girls. She ignores the pleas from her family to stop, until the Fonz defines what cool really means

programme.title: Happy Days: Richie Gets Framed
programme.desc: Richie and the Fonz visit a massage parlor to escape the pressures of a heated class presidency race, and Richie's opposition photographs the sheet-clad candidate with a pretty masseuse.

programme.title: Happy Days: The First Thanksgiving
programme.desc: Members of the Happy Days gang find themselves transformed into Pilgrims when Marion dreams of reviving the true spirit of Thanksgiving.

programme.title: Myth Hunters
programme.desc: Two families over three generations are locked in a battle to find the lost treasure of Japan‚Äôs last Shogun.

programme.title: Myth Hunters
programme.desc: August Gissler‚Äôs amazing seventeen year quest to find the buried pirate treasure on Cocos Island
programme.sub-title: The Pirate Treasure of Cocos Island

programme.title: Myth Hunters
programme.desc: A vast treasure of Spanish gold is buried somewhere in Texas. Dave Arnold, guided by a map, discovers three mysterious stones he believes are keys to the treasure. His 7-year quest leads to a mysterious death, financial ruin, and an ancient curse.
programme.sub-title: The Mystery of the Spider Rocks

programme.title: Myth Hunters
programme.desc: For 70 years, treasure hunters have sought Rennes-le-Chateau's secret. In the 19th century, priest Berenger Sauniere became mysteriously wealthy. His confidante, Marie Denarnaud, hinted at the treasure but died before revealing it.
programme.sub-title: The Priest His Lover and the Holy Grail

programme.title: Myth Hunters
programme.desc: Searching for the truth behind one of the Church‚Äôs most mysterious relics ‚Äì the Veil of Veronica ‚Äì this programme follows the discovery and impact of the miraculous face of Manoppello ‚Äì an image not made by human hands of the resurrected Christ.

programme.title: Myth Hunters
programme.desc: The extraordinary story of Hiram Bingham's amazing discovery of one of the great wonders of the modern world, Machu Picchu.

programme.title: Myth Hunters
programme.desc: WW2 legendary Japanese looted gold is hunted by an amateur Filipino treasure-hunter

programme.title: Myth Hunters
programme.desc: California Gold Rush prospector goes in search of a legendary lost treasure ship in the Mojave Desert.
programme.sub-title: The Lost Ship of the Mojave Desert

programme.title: Myth Hunters
programme.desc: In WWII's final days, Nazis hid evidence of their crimes. SS officers transported boxes to Austria's remote Lake Toplitz, witnessed dumping them on May 1, 1945. Rumors. Rumors claimed the boxes held stolen gold, part of a $500M Nazi heist.

programme.title: Myth Hunters
programme.desc: In 1897, two brothers began a 50-year quest to find a treasure buried 70 years earlier in the Virginia Blue Mountains, documented in a secret code. They sought help from America's top code-breakers to unravel Thomas Beale‚Äôs treasure mystery.
programme.sub-title: The Mystery of Thomas Beale's Treasure

programme.title: Myth Hunters
programme.desc: According to legend, King Arthur was Britain‚Äôs greatest king. He led his Knights of the Round Table from Camelot, a spectacular castle, and fought Anglo-Saxon invaders, uniting the country. Leslie Alcock led a team to find Camelot.

programme.title: Myth Hunters
programme.desc: This is the amazing story of how a two amateur explorers discovered one of the world's greatest civilisations, the Maya.
programme.sub-title: The Men Who Found the Maya

programme.title: Myth Hunters
programme.desc: A fortune in gold is buried in the Rocky Mountains, with only a cryptic map as a clue. For nearly 200 years, descendants of a French expedition have sought it. But the Curse of Treasure Mountain has thwarted all attempts to find the hidden bullion.

programme.title: Myth Hunters
programme.desc: American writer and historan Janice Bennett goes on a quest to prove the Holy Chalice of Valencia - a relic displayed within its cathedral for over 500 years - is the original cup of Christ used at the Last Supper.

programme.title: The Conspiracy Show With Richard Syrett
programme.desc: Richard examines the growing UFO Disclosure movement and its attempts to force the US Government to reveal to the public what it knows about UFOs and aliens.

programme.title: The Conspiracy Show With Richard Syrett
programme.desc: Richard speaks with the founders of Architects and Engineers for 911 Truth and Firefighters for 911 Truth who present their case that the WTC towers were brought down by controlled demolition on 9/11.

programme.title: The Conspiracy Show With Richard Syrett
programme.desc: An investigation into the practice of past-life regression therapy; a technique where subjects are placed under hypnosis in order to recover memories of supposed past lives.

programme.title: The Conspiracy Show With Richard Syrett

programme.title: The New Detectives: Medical Examiners's Casebook
programme.desc: Some killers choose to hide their victims. And investigators must then rely on forensic examiners to uncover proof of murder. These are just two extraordinary crimes that have made their way into the medical examiner's casebook.

programme.title: The New Detectives: Blind Trust
programme.desc: A woman's body is found and investigators have little time and few clues to lead them to a killer who could strike again. Perpetrators try to conceal their crimes, yet savvy investigators can take the most obscure data and recreate a murder.

programme.title: The New Detectives: Cold Cases
programme.desc: These cases took a decade or more to solve. There's no statute of limitations on murder. As a case turns cold, the clues become scarce, investigators must rely on science to close cold cases.

programme.title: The New Detectives: Without A Trace
programme.desc: Missing Person: Approximately 1.8 million Americans are reported missing each year. Worldwide, the number of missing persons nearly triples.

programme.title: The New Detectives: Broken Vowes
programme.desc: When lovers turn on each other, or marriages fail, some ruthless spouses find a grisly way to gain an uncontested divorce ¬ñ with no paperwork. When murder tears lovers apart, forensic science must put piece together the mystery to catch the killer.

programme.title: The New Detectives: Deadly intentions
programme.desc: When abduction turns to murder, forensic science is the only key to finding justice for the victims of a kidnapper's deadly intentions.

programme.title: The New Detectives: Partners In Crime
programme.desc: They say that a burden shared is a burden halved, but when partners team up to commit murder, the weight of their guilt remains just as heavy. Investigators must rely on forensic science to capture partners in crime.

programme.title: The New Detectives: Trails of Evidence
programme.desc: In criminal investigations, a simple clue can provide the missing link by placing a suspect at a crime scene. Dirt left on shoes, tires or clothes, or even a tiny piece of plastic can pinpoint a crime scene.

programme.title: The New Detectives: Murder By Numbers
programme.desc: For serial killers, once is never enough. For investigators, the challenge is steep when the killers murder by numbers.

programme.title: The New Detectives: Flames Of Justice
programme.desc: Arson fires are set for their own sake, or to cover a different crime, such as murder. Think fire consumes all vital clues? Think again. Arson investigators can glean important clues from scorched rubble and ignite the unquenchable flames of justice.

programme.title: The New Detectives: Murderous Attraction
programme.desc: In Columbus, Ohio, a woman is found shot in the head. The death is ruled a suicide, but something is not right and detectives refuse to let the matter rest.

programme.title: The New Detectives: Deadly Target
programme.desc: Ballistics: A corpse is found with a gunshot wound to the head; the weapon lies next to the victim. It looks like suicide, but could it be murder? It's a question best solved by ballistics experts.

programme.title: The New Detectives: In The Line of Fire
programme.desc: Bombers, snipers, spree killers: some people don't care who they kill, they just want to hurt innocent people.

programme.title: The New Detectives: Critical Evidence
programme.desc: To the astute detective and forensic specialist, the biggest clues often hide in plain sight, and what seems trivial to some is in reality Critical Evidence.

programme.title: The New Detectives
programme.desc: Lies and deceit can often throw investigators off the trail of justice. But when hard evidence contradicts a killer's story, police must use the clues to piece together the truth.

programme.title: The New Detectives: For Love Or Money

programme.title: The New Detectives: Presumed Dead

programme.desc: Castalians board the Andromeda to finalize the charter for the New Commonwealth. When the leader is discovered dead, Tyr is the main suspect.

programme.title: Andromeda
programme.desc: Beka learns that her father's former business partner deals in a highly addictive drug called F lash.
programme.sub-title: The Pearls That Were His Eyes

programme.title: Andromeda
programme.desc: The Andromeda discovers her sister ship, the Pax Magellanic. The crew aboard Pax is 300 years old, but have not aged a day.

programme.title: Andromeda: Music of a Distant Drum
programme.desc: Tyr crash lands the Eureka Maru on a Nietzschean planet and develops amnesia. He must remember what he is doing before the Nietzscheans discover him and his crate of stolen goods.

programme.title: Andromeda: Harper 2.0
programme.desc: Harper receives the gift of knowledge from a dying Perseid, only to discover that the Perseid was being sought by a bounty hunter who has now turned his attention to Harper.

programme.title: Andromeda: Forced Perspective
programme.desc: Dylan is arrested for assassinating a dictator 300 years ago.

programme.title: Andromeda: The Sum of Its Parts
programme.desc: Andromeda is boarded by a drone from the Consensus of Parts, a mythical mechanical society. While friendly at first, the drone tries to force the ship to join the Consensus.

programme.title: Andromeda: Fear and Loathing in the Milky Way
programme.desc: Gerentex is back, and demands Trance and Harper help him with his new scheme: finding Tarn-Vedra.
programme.sub-title: Fear and Loathing in the Milky Way

programme.title: Andromeda: The Devil Take the Hindmost
programme.desc: Dylan and Rev Bem help a peaceful society to stand up to their would-be slavers. They have to be careful because if Dylan teaches them to kill, their kids will be born knowing it.

programme.title: Andromeda: The Honey Offering
programme.desc: Dylan attempts to bring peace to two different Nietzschean prides by escorting the princess of one to her arranged marriage to the prince of the other.

programme.title: Sensing Murder: A Bump in the Night
programme.desc: In 1980, six-year-old Alicia O'Reilly was raped and murdered in her bed, while her sister slept less than a metre away, and her mother sleeping across the hallway.

programme.title: Sensing Murder
programme.desc: ‚ÄúSensing Murder‚Äù psychics are challenged to connect with the spirit of murdered Christchurch scrap-metal dealer, John Reynolds, to discover his killer and reveal the truth surrounding the violent attack.

programme.title: Sensing Murder: Psychics Revealed - Special
programme.desc: Behind the scenes with the psychics on the show.

programme.title: Sensing Murder: Into Thin Air
programme.desc: Jim Donnelly was a hard-working family man living a quiet life in suburban Auckland. For 20 years he‚Äôd worked as a scientist at the Glenbrook Steel Mill, south of Auckland. On the 21st of June 2004, he simply vanished into thin air.

programme.title: Sensing Murder: Fallen Angel
programme.desc: In this episode of Sensing Murder we learn about the murder of Angela Blackmoore, a 21 year old woman with a 2 year old child. The child was not harmed and the killer has not been found.

programme.title: Sensing Murder: Where There's Smoke
programme.desc: In 2006, 19-year-old Blake Stott died in a mysterious car fire. Blake had seemingly pulled into a South Otago lay-by to have a sleep, when his late-model, un-modified car burst into flames.

programme.title: Sensing Murder
programme.desc: Our new team of ‚Äú Sensing Murder‚Äù psychics are challenged to unmask the killer ‚Äì or killers ‚Äì of vivacious New Zealand hairdresser Paula Brown who was plucked from Sydney‚Äôs downtown after a night out with friends.

programme.title: Sensing Murder: Lost Soul
programme.desc: In 1985, 25-year-old Luana 'La Verne' Williams disappeared from her Tauranga home. Eight years later her disappearance was upgraged to a murder enquiry. Her body has never been found.

programme.title: Sensing Murder: Blood Money
programme.desc: Psychics Kelvin Cruickshank (NZ) and Deb Webber (Aus) investigate the unsolved murder of Lower Hutt pensioner 91 year old George Engelbrecht. In 1979, a burglar broke into George's home and beat the old man to death in his bed.

programme.title: Sensing Murder: Without Warning
programme.desc: This week‚Äôs episode of Sensing Murder promises greater co-operation between psychics and police, attempting to uncover the truth about the death of 18-year-old apprentice plumber Regan O‚ÄôDonoghue, who was killed in a hit and run in 2007.

programme.title: Sensing Murder: Out of the Dark
programme.desc: Described as a brutal execution, 46-year-old grandmother Chattrice Maihi-Carroll was found naked, stabbed to death in her New Zealand home in 2008. There were multiple suspects and everything seemed resolved following the arrest of a neighbour.

programme.title: Sensing Murder: Where's Grandad?
programme.desc: 65-year-old Alan Gordon Woodford of Bedford St. Mossburn left his home on foot Saturday morning April 20, 1985 and was never seen or heard of again.

programme.title: Sensing Murder: Lost for Words
programme.desc: Spirited teenager Jayne Furlong dreamed of becoming a child psychologist - instead, she ended up a prostitute. In 1993, 17 year old Jayne vanished from her patch on Auckland's Karangahape Road.

programme.title: Sensing Murder
programme.desc: ‚ÄúSensing Murder‚Äù psychics are challenged to connect with the spirit of 53-year-old, Cynthia Greenwood-Smith, to unravel the lies and discover the grim truth surrounding her disappearance from her Gold Coast home in 2001.

programme.title: Sensing Murder: Stone Cold
programme.desc: In 2004, Brendan Percy was found dead of hypothermia and dehydration in a sub alpine area above Oamaru in suspicious circumstances.

programme.title: Crime Investigation Australia: The Killing Fields of Truro
programme.desc: For the 2008 launch of Crime Investigation Australia, CI presents the complete and compelling story of "The Killing Fields of Truro", one of the most infamous crimes in Australia and yet another set in Adelaide.

programme.title: Crime Investigation Australia: Kid for Ransom / Tears for Daniel
programme.desc: We examine two notorious abduction cases. The first case is the Graeme Thorne ransom kidnapping at Bondi in 1960. Thorne, aged eight, was the son of winners of the Sydney Opera House Lottery.
programme.sub-title: Kid for Ransom / Tears for Daniel

programme.title: Crime Investigation Australia: The Body in the Sports Bag
programme.desc: A young Sydney man was found guilty of strangling his ex-girlfriend and stuffing the teenager's body in a cricket bag.
programme.sub-title: The Body in the Sports Bag

programme.title: Crime Investigation Australia: Hunt for a Killer: The Claremont Murders
programme.desc: This chilling CIA episode details the long and difficult investigation which began with the disappearance of 18-year-old secretary Sarah Spiers from a night club in the up-market Perth suburb of Claremont on Australia Day 1996.
programme.sub-title: Hunt for a Killer: The Claremont Murders

programme.title: Crime Investigation Australia: The Anita Cobby Murder
programme.desc: In February 1986, nurse Anita Cobby, a former entrant in the Miss Australia quest, is walking home from Blacktown station in Sydney's outer-western suburbs. A Holden sedan pulls up and Anita is dragged into the vehicle.

programme.title: Crime Investigation Australia: A Killer Amongst Us: The Norfolk Island Murder
programme.desc: On Easter Sunday 2002, on sleepy Norfolk Island in the south west Pacific, the body of 29-year-old Janelle Patton was found lying in an open field.
programme.sub-title: A Killer Amongst Us: The Norfolk Island Murder

programme.title: Crime Investigation Australia: The Gonzales Family Murders
programme.desc: On July 10, 2001, Sef Gonzales murdered his sister Clodine, 18, mother Mary Loiva Josephine, 43, and his father Teddy, 46, in their North Ryde home.

programme.title: Crime Investigation Australia: Snowtown: Bodies in the Barrels
programme.desc: In 1999, eight bodies are found in six barrels filled with acid in a former bank vault in rural Snowtown, 50 kilometres north of Adelaide.

programme.title: Crime Investigation Australia: The Butchered Boys
programme.desc: This episode revisits Adelaide's notorious Adelaide Family Murders case, where six young Adelaide men were murdered during the 1970s and '80s. The victims were found in random locations throughout the state, their bodies neatly cut into pieces.

programme.title: Crime Investigation Australia: Cop Killer: The Winchester Assassination
programme.desc: The highest ranking police officer in Australia to be murdered, Assistant Federal Police Commissioner Colin Winchester was shot twice in the head at point blank range as he was getting out of his car outside his Deakin home on 10 January 1989.

programme.title: Crime Investigation Australia: The Devil Inside: John Ernest Cribb
programme.desc: A chilling investigation of John Ernest Cribb, who on August 11, 1978 broke into the home of the Connell's. On a winter‚Äôs afternoon, Valda Connell and her four-year-old son Damien arrived home after having collected ten-year-old Sally from school.
programme.sub-title: The Devil Inside: John Ernest Cribb

programme.title: Crime Investigation Australia: Michael Kanaan: Shoot to Kill
programme.desc: Michael Kanaan was an angry young man in a hurry to make a name for himself in Sydney‚Äôs underworld. But his volatile temper and penchant for violence soon led him to kill three men before he was finally captured in a wild shootout with Sydney police.

programme.title: Crime Investigation Australia: The Greenough Family Massacre
programme.desc: The small hamlet of Greenough, near Geraldton in Western Australia, some 400 kilometres north of Perth, will forever be associated with one the most horrific murders in Australian criminal history.

programme.title: Crime Investigation Australia: Mystery of the Homestead Murders
programme.desc: The quick mind of a country telephone exchange supervisor led to a horrific discovery at a NSW country homestead in 1978.

programme.title: Crime Investigation Australia: The Predator: Leonard John Fraser
programme.desc: Serial killer Leonard Fraser was suspected of killing at least five women over a 17 year period but took the complete truth about his life of crime to his grave.

programme.title: Crime Investigation Australia: Night of Terror: The Bega Schoolgirls
programme.desc: On the 6th October 1997, 14-year-old Lauren Barry and 16-year-old Nicole Collins disappeared while walking along a road near their home town of Bega, on the New South Wales south coast.
programme.sub-title: Night of Terror: The Bega Schoolgirls

programme.title: McLeod's Daughters: Once Were Heros
programme.desc: Dave risks his career to save a herd of mistreated horses. Jodi tries to stop Luke from gambling his car, with disastrous consequences for both of them.

programme.title: McLeod's Daughters: Return of the Black
programme.desc: Jodi struggles to find a new career after being sacked from Drovers Run. Sandra risks her marriage and her property to get even with Harry.

programme.title: McLeod's Daughters: Do you read me ‚Ä¶.?
programme.desc: Stevie puts her life at risk when she and Alex uncover a horse-substitution scam. Jodi makes a huge sacrifice to prove her love to Luke.

programme.title: McLeod's Daughters: Taking care of business
programme.desc: When Kate resigns from Drovers Run, Stevie and Tess face an uphill battle to run the property. Jodi and Kate struggle in their new careers away from Drovers Run.

programme.title: McLeod's Daughters: Old Flames
programme.desc: Passions flare up when Kate faces her first love, and Jodi risks her life to save her high-school nemesis. Sparks fly between Dave and Sally at her farewell dinner.

programme.title: McLeod's Daughters: Body Blows
programme.desc: Alex re-considers his future at Killarney when his father suffers a stroke. Jodi goes to extreme lengths to win a bull showing on her own terms.

programme.title: McLeod's Daughters: Sins of a Father
programme.desc: Stevie and Alex work together to trap a cattle thief with inside knowledge. Tess‚Äôs life is turned upside down when Nick learns he has a deadly heart condition.

programme.title: McLeod's Daughters: Boy Made Good
programme.desc: Stevie‚Äôs past catches up with her when her daughter‚Äôs father arrives unexpectedly in Gungellan. Jodi uncovers a bizarre secret about Stevie‚Äôs former lover.

programme.title: McLeod's Daughters: The Pearl
programme.desc: Jodi risks everything to help Luke, when she learns he has been blackmailed by a criminal gang.

programme.title: McLeod's Daughters: The Prodigal Daughter
programme.desc: Tess‚Äôs mysterious cousin, Regan, makes instant enemies when she visits Drovers Run. Stevie must rely on Regan‚Äôs help to escape a life-threatening farm accident.

programme.title: McLeod's Daughters: Love and Obsession
programme.desc: As Dave and Regan fall for each other, Kate realises Regan has a secret she‚Äôll do anything to protect.

programme.title: McLeod's Daughters: One Long Day
programme.desc: Stevie faces the most harrowing hour of her life when Charlotte goes missing on Drovers Run. When Nick is offered a job in Argentina, Tess is torn between her husband and her property.

programme.title: McLeod's Daughters: Down to Earth
programme.desc: Tess delays her flight to Argentina, when she learns of Regan‚Äôs plans to mine Drovers Run. Jodi and Alex take an instant dislike to Killarney‚Äôs arrogant new overseer.

programme.title: McLeod's Daughters: Heart of Gold
programme.desc: It‚Äôs McLeod versus McLeod as Tess fights to stop Regan‚Äôs mining claim on Drovers Run.

programme.title: McLeod's Daughters: Taking Flight
programme.desc: With Tess and Nick gone, Stevie is determined to prove herself as manager of Drovers Run. Dave and Kate form an unlikely team in the local Twitchathon.

programme.title: McLeod's Daughters: Make Believe
programme.desc: Kate has fibbed to her grandmother about her job and her ‚Äòfianc√©‚Äô Dave ‚Äì now grandmother is coming to visit.

programme.title: McLeod's Daughters: Heaven And Earth
programme.desc: As a raging dust storm approaches, Stevie battles to save a life.

programme.title: McLeod's Daughters: Moonstruck
programme.desc: Alex is overcome by toxic fumes while cleaning an old water tank. Jodi advises Meg on how to fix her relationship with Terry.

programme.title: McLeod's Daughters: If You Build It
programme.desc: Stevie locks horns with Sandra, but finds herself helping Sandra through a crisis.

programme.title: McLeod's Daughters: Out of Time
programme.desc: Stevie faces the biggest decision of her life: should she tell her daughter Rose who her real mother is?

programme.title: McLeod's Daughters: Betwixt and Between
programme.desc: Rose discovers her life is a lie and Stevie pays a terrible price.

programme.title: Ghost Hunters
programme.desc: Despite mysterious and unnerving warnings from locals, the Ghost Hunters face their fears and stay on mission: to help people confront terrifying paranormal encounters that have shaken them to their core.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Love on the Run
programme.desc: Today Dog finds himself looking for more than one fugitive. He starts the day looking for a woman who has skipped out on her court date. But he soon learns that she has teamed up with a woman whose criminal exploits have attracted the local media.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Jump Start
programme.desc: Dog gave a break to a young man with a drug problem who promised to enter drug rehab. But this commitment to rehabilitation seems to have ended when he bolted from the car on the way to the drug treatment center and went on the run.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: The Ice Man
programme.desc: Dog's latest fugitive doesn't think small when it comes to illegal drugs: he was carrying almost a pound of meth when he was arrested. Now he's on the run with his pregnant girlfriend on the high plains of Colorado.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Trouble in Paradise
programme.desc: Dog is back in Hawaii and tracking a dangerous fugitive through the jungles of the Big Island. Their prey is being protected by a ring of family and friends that Dog must forcefully confront to bring in his man.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Girl Power
programme.desc: When Dog decides to spend the day caring for his newest granddaughter, Beth enlists the girls to hunt down a female fugitive. Heading into a dangerous part of town the ladies will use their feminine wiles to track this mother gone wrong.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Prodigal Son
programme.desc: Dog and his old friends, Tim Chapman and Sonny Westbrook are riding with the team, so their target, a thief with violent tendencies, is out of luck. When Dog learns that the fugitive is also a disrespectful son, he is more motivated to find his man.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Family Ties
programme.desc: Dog doesn't have the whole team today and he's got to catch a fugitive with a record of criminal assault. But when Dog finds the fugitive's former girlfriend, she thinks he isn't dangerous at all.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Special Delivery
programme.desc: For months, this fugitive has been stringing Leland along with a series of barely believable excuses. Out of patience, Leland calls in the Big Dog. The whole team heads out to put pressure on the family and friends of the fugitive.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Surface Scratches
programme.desc: Dog's latest quarry is running from abuse and assault charges. As Dog investigates, he discovers that this fugitive has gamed the system by jumping from one bond, and one bondsman, to another.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: The Great Debate
programme.desc: When the co-signer of a bond is also romantically involved with the defendant, sometimes the bondman is put in the middle of a lover's quarrel.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Facebooked
programme.desc: Dog is in Denver helping Bobby Brown to track down a fugitive with a long rap sheet. But unfortunately they have no picture of the felon to work with, so the challenges are big on this one. But Dog discovers a new source; "Facebook".

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Mano-a-Mano
programme.desc: Back in Colorado, Dog's on the hunt for a runner with more than a decade's worth of trouble with the law. But the fugitive's friends and family are reluctant to help Dog bring him in.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: The Road Show: Where Mercy is Shown
programme.desc: After releasing the second part of his autobiography, Dog and his family traveled across America, and this very special episode offers an intimate portrait of both the public and private moments of that journey.
programme.sub-title: The Road Show: Where Mercy is Shown

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: The Comeback Kid
programme.desc: Dog is back in Colorado chasing a young man with a taste for trouble. He's fled to Texas but with his family's house on the line Dog is willing to try a risky strategy.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Tent City
programme.desc: Today's hunt takes Dog far from the glittering hotels of Waikiki to the parts of Hawaii tourist rarely see, Oahu's ramshackle tent cities. The team searches for a woman who has lost almost everything, her home, her family and her spirit.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: And Baby Makes Three
programme.desc: Leland has to attend a Lamaze class before he can join the hunt--another Chapman is on the way! But when Dog starts to go after this accused jewelry thief without his fastest son, he learns that this fugitive puts the "R" in runner.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: The Tender Trap
programme.desc: When Dog discovers today's prey is a notorious ladies man, he knows just how to lure him in. The trap includes a suggestive phone call, a motel rendezvous, and a crew of bounty hunters waiting in the next room ready to break up the party!

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Greed is Good
programme.desc: Today's fugitive is accused of assaulting a police officer, so Dog and the team are not taking any chances. Dog has to play on his target's greed and deploy some modern technology to set a trap for this runner.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Tears for Fears
programme.desc: Baby Lyssa wakes up in a jail cell, but ignores the ensuing media frenzy in order to befriend a woman waging a personal battle against drug addiction.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Picture This
programme.desc: A fugitive with a long criminal record has fled to Hawaii, and the bondsman on the mainland has asked Dog for help. Dog doesn't have much information to work with, but he can use the felon's desire to impress his friends to track him down.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Tag, You're It
programme.desc: To his traditional bounty hunting tools of confidential informants, canvassing, and silver-tongued subterfuge the world's greatest bounty hunter has added Facebook! A word to the wise for those on the run-post at your own peril, the Dog is watching!

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: A Family Affair
programme.desc: Dog likes to say, "The apple doesn't fall far from the tree," and this is a hunt where that is true. So will Dog be able to use one family member's troubled ways to catch another one in trouble with the law?

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Training Day
programme.desc: While the team tries to handle the bond that newcomer Alysin wrote incorrectly, sparks are flying between Beth and Duane Lee when he questions Beth's decision to go on the hunt without Dog leading the charge!

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Cutting the Apron Strings
programme.desc: Two different young men both have a bad habit of missing their court dates. Looking over their files Dog senses that they have another trait in common, both are a little too tied to their mothers.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Short Handed
programme.desc: Dog's target today has a history of violence, and apparently plans to re-locate without notifying the proper authorities. Unfortunately the team is missing a key player, Duane Lee is MIA today distracted by his new lady love.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Photo Op
programme.desc: Dog and Duane Lee can't agree about what role Duane Lee should have in the family business. But the family comes together as they set out to hunt a chronic violator with an open warrant and a wife who has an odd request for Dog.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Samurai Si
programme.desc: Willie receives a special gift from a Japanese business associate - a "priceless" samurai sword, which Willie keeps out of the hands of Jase and the guys.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Duck No, We Won't Go
programme.desc: Willie pushes his work force too far after implementing new "motivational work tactics," and the guys rise up against him and go on strike.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Drag Me To Glory
programme.desc: When NASCAR sensation Clint Bowyer pays a visit to the Duck Commander warehouse, Willie and the guys are fired up to spend the day hanging out with the professional racecar driver.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Duck Season Eve
programme.desc: Tomorrow is the opening day of Duck Season and the men are carrying on their tradition of camping on the Robertson Land the night before.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Can't Hardly Weight
programme.desc: Gearing up for his high school reunion, Willie realizes that he could stand to lose a few pounds. Jase and Korie set out to help him drop some weight and the strenuous battle of man-versus-waistline begins.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Shot Thru The Heart
programme.desc: The guys learn from Willie that John Luke is going through his first break up. In order to make him feel better the men decide to take John Luke hunting for nutria, and impart their relationship wisdom.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Here Lizard, Lizard
programme.desc: When the warehouse guys new office pet (a lizard) escapes, they try all they can in order to catch the wily reptile. Proving impossible, the guys finally decide to bring in the big guns to help trap it--Mr. Phil Robertson.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Hallu-Si-Nations
programme.desc: With Willie out-of-town, the guys decide to flake off work and leave to brush up the duck blinds on the Robertson land. While out, Si believes he spots what he thinks is the infamous 'Black Panther'.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Let's Go Hunting, Deer
programme.desc: Willie and Jase invite Korie and Missy along on a deer hunt because they believe their wives have become too "city." At Phil and Kay's, Miss Kay decides she wants to frame Phil's original blueprints from the first duck call he created.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Tickets To The Fun Show
programme.desc: During Duck Commander's "Casino Night" party, Si Robertson wins the grand prize of $2000 and decides to buy a massage chair for the duck call room. The massage chair becomes a detriment to the workflow, so Willie takes Si around for a replacement prize.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Duck Be a Lady
programme.desc: Sadie, has a homecoming dance coming up, but Willie doesn't approve of her dress selection. Willie decides to take Sadie out to find her a new "appropriate" dress.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Ring Around the Redneck
programme.desc: Though Jase lost his wedding ring long ago, Missy decides it's time for Jase to replace it with a new one. When Jase is duck hunting, once again, he loses the ring.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Bass Man Standing
programme.desc: The Duck Commander team is invited to unveil a wing of the local Bass Pro shop that will feature their products.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Battle of the Brothers
programme.desc: Willie's suspicious behavior from dyeing his beard to buying a new motorcycle, makes Jase come to the conclusion that Willie is having a mid-life crisis.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Aloha, Robertsons!
programme.desc: After all their hard work, Willie decides to take the entire Robertson clan on a family vacation to Hawaii. But Willie's daily itinerary for the trip gets constantly undermined by the family's desire to participate in their own island activities.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Till Duck Do Us Part
programme.desc: Everyone comes together to plan a surprise wedding for Phil and Kay, setting up a special ceremony on their land, which the whole family attends. Si distracts Phil and Kay by taking them on a "trip down memory lane".

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: So You Think You Can Date?
programme.desc: After discovering that Martin has to miss a Friday night poker game for a date, the guys (as well as their wives) take turns figuring out the best way to coach him for romance. When babysitting for Jep and Jessica turns into a rocky road.
programme.sub-title: So You Think You Can Date?

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Hot Tub Grime Machine
programme.desc: The guys realize that Godwin has never really asked them for a favor, even though they are all always helping each other out. Godwin asks them to help him get a hot tub, so they set out to help him pick one up.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: A-Jase-ent Living
programme.desc: Due to construction at Jase and Missy's house, Willie and Korie invite Jase and the kids to live with them while Missy is out of town visiting friends. Then, what begins in the duck call room as a series of "Gentlemen's Bets".

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Termite Be a Problem
programme.desc: Because of a termite problem at Duck Commander, the guys are forced to find a different location to work from - Godwin's House. But while at Godwin's house, Godwin gets a taxidermied gift from a past relative.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: John Luke After Dentist
programme.desc: John Luke and Sadie are getting some dental work done, complete with sedation, and it's up to Willie and Korie to take care of them through the process - including getting them back home safely.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Scoot Along Si
programme.desc: Si shows up to work on a mobility scooter, claiming to have an invisible injury from a fender bender with Willie. After losing her beloved turtle "Mr. T", Ms. Kay enlists Phil on a mission to find a new pet turtle.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Jerky Boys
programme.desc: A decision to try and make some duck jerky leads the boys to Godwin's garage and a minibike race. Phil and Kay have made Willie the executor of their will, and Phil wants to show Willie what he and his brothers will inherit when he and Kay pass away.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Going Si-ral
programme.desc: Si discovers Youtube, and, after watching a series of instructional videos, decides he can make something better. John Luke totals Willie's truck, and Willie realizes he may be raising the two worst drivers in all of Louisiana.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Quack-O-Lantern
programme.desc: The Robertsons host a Halloween event at Duck Commander, where they all come together to transform the warehouse into a "scarehouse." Everyone dresses up and Willie desperately tries to be the scariest, but none of the kids are afraid of him.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: O Little Town of West Monroe
programme.desc: The Robertsons perform a live nativity for their Church for Christmas, so the wives organize rehearsals to ensure that they pull off a great event. However, rehearsals get off to a bumpy start as the guys can't stop sharing their opinions.
programme.sub-title: O Little Town of West Monroe

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Boomerang Becca
programme.desc: When Rebecca returns home from her internship in Los Angeles, the Robertson family plans a big surprise party to welcome her back. Meanwhile, when Uncle Si gets sick, he seeks the help of Ms. Kay to take care of him.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Willie's Number Two
programme.desc: When Willie is looking to hire a new assistant, Korie insists he interviews her cousin, JD. Meanwhile, when Uncle Si spends the day over at Phil and Kay's, Jep stops by with the kids to keep them away from Jessica, who has taken ill.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Life of Si
programme.desc: After seeing footage Jep shot using a GoPro, Si decides he wants to use the camera to record a day in his life. But when Si gets on the guys nerves while they're hunting, they kick him and his GoPros out of the blind.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: From Duck 'til Dawn
programme.desc: When the duck guys have to pull an all-nighter to finish some work, Willie decides he wants to join them. But when a dying smoke detector distracts them from their work, Jase and Willie head off to disarm it.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Burger Commander
programme.desc: After visiting a popular burger restaurant, Willie and Jase get into a debate over which of them cooks the best burger, prompting them to challenge one another to a cooking contest.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: G.I. Si
programme.desc: When Willie and Jase argue over an old G.I. Joe toy, it leads them into a debate over who would make a better soldier. To settle the score, Willie and Jase head out to the woods with their friends and children for a paintball match.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Jase and the Argonauts
programme.desc: When Willie gets a soft serve machine for himself, he tells the guys they can't use it until they're done working. But when Jase thinks this is unfair, he takes matters into his own hands and finds a better object to use as motivation.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Fowl Playhouse
programme.desc: When Jase finds out Jep is planning to buy his kids a fancy playhouse from a catalogue, he and the guys decide to build one for Jep themselves. But the playhouse ends up looking more like a military-style duck blind.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: The Big LeCOWski
programme.desc: When Sadie spends the day at Duck Commander for a school project, the guys try to show her the ins-and-outs of how a successful company works. But when Willie questions Jase's ingenuity in creating new products they get into a debate.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The Robertson family pulls together a family reunion to give Mia a big send-off before her surgery.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Governor's Travels
programme.desc: When the Governor of Louisiana announces that he will be coming to Duck Commander to present Willie with a commerce award, John Luke volunteers to give the introduction speech.

programme.title: Operation Repo: Going Green and Falling Down
programme.desc: First, Sonia and Froy arrive on the scene to a repo a car that's been refitted to run on biodiesel and are shocked to see that its owner shares some of Sonia's features.

programme.title: Operation Repo: Look What You Did!
programme.desc: First, Sonia and Froy get locked in the battle of a lifetime with a pair of young debtors who are understandably upset that their late-model Tahoe has found its way to the bottom of a lake. Is it Froy's fault, as they claim, or are there other forces at..

programme.title: Operation Repo: That's Disrespectful
programme.desc: First, Sonia and Lyndah are faced with a choice. Do they attempt to reclaim a burnt-out husk of a car from its high-flying owners, or do they just give up and go home?

programme.title: Operation Repo: Smoke, Lead, and Alcohol
programme.desc: First, Matt and Froy venture into one of the city's most dangerous neighborhoods, only to find a debtor ready to defend his ride by pumping it full of lead, with no concern for who gets caught in the crossfire.

programme.title: Operation Repo: Missed Dates
programme.desc: First, Lyndah is put in a tough situation - she has to control a sobbing, cop-calling debtor and turn away Frankie's unwanted and inappropriate advances - all at the same time. Then, Matt and Froy have two problems on their hands.

programme.title: Operation Repo: Broken Tooth Lou and Bad Breath Frankie
programme.desc: First, Froy and Lyndah probably need to schedule a trip to the dentist after Lou's tooth gets knocked out in the course of a tense confrontation with two irate debtors. Then, Frankie seriously blows a routine voluntary repo when the owner smells something
programme.sub-title: Broken Tooth Lou and Bad Breath Frankie

programme.title: Operation Repo: Matt Vs. Giant Chicken
programme.desc: First, Matt and Froy cope with the uncertainty of Lou's condition by liberating a Vespa from a leather-clad biker and his rabble-rousing girlfriend. Then, Matt and Froy head out again to claim a Toyota Yaris from a truant children's entertainer.

programme.title: Operation Repo: Segway This Way
programme.desc: First, Matt and Sonia hit the beach to repossess an old-fashioned classic surfer car from an old-fashioned surfer looking for a classic tussle. Then, Froy and Matt stretch their wits to identify and take down an uncooperative Segway renter.

programme.title: Operation Repo: The Canals of Deceit
programme.desc: First, Sonia and Froy get messy when they head to Venice Beach to track down and recover a canoe from the world-famous canals. Then, Lyndah and Sonia confront a distraught widow with a terrible secret. And finally, there's no time-out for Lou and Matt...

programme.title: Operation Repo: Captain Lou
programme.desc: First, Lyndah and Matt interrupt a debtor's bicycle ride to repossess his Jeep, but when Matt's buttons get pushed, some bikes might get broken. Then, Froy and Sonia negotiate with a sensible debtor who's more trouble than she seems... or is she? And fina

programme.title: Operation Repo: Native Operation
programme.desc: First, Matt and Lou confront an ungentlemanly drunk at an upscale gentleman's club in an effort to repossess his late-model BMW. Then, Sonia and Matt head over to the wrong side of the tracks to reclaim a motorcycle from a different kind of biker.

programme.title: Operation Repo: Should Have Seen This Coming
programme.desc: First, Lou, Sonia, and Froy unfurl an elaborate sting when they repo a taxicab by tricking its driver into picking them up. But what to do with his ferociously inebriated client?

programme.title: Operation Repo: Vampires and Drunks
programme.desc: First, Froy and Sonia take a trip to Beverly Hills to interrupt the salon appointment of a wealthy trophy wife who isn't going to let her prized possession go without a fight. Then, Sonia and Matt use the cover of night to sneak away a Nissan.

programme.title: Operation Repo: I Don't Know What That Is
programme.desc: First, Matt and Froy crash a raucous brew-fest to sneak an ATV away from a crowd of tipsy revelers. Then, Matt and Lou come face-to-face with a fraternity prank gone awry - these college kids have a sledgehammer, and they're not afraid to use it.
programme.sub-title: I Don't Know What That Is

programme.title: Operation Repo: Incompetent and Unfaithful
programme.desc: First, Matt and Froy slip into a gated community for a repossession only to attract the attention of a trio of irate and incompetent security guards. Then, Lou and Sonia come face-to-face with a debtor and her entire adult-league softball team.

programme.title: Operation Repo: Don't Cry, Bro
programme.desc: First, Matt and Froy track a car to the compound of what seems to be a polygamist cult. Will their charismatic leader put up a fight for his Prius, or will he have his followers do it for him?

programme.title: Operation Repo: Don't Spray Me with That
programme.desc: First, Sonia and Froy repossess an experimental concept motorcycle from a hose-wielding yuppie. Then, Froy and Sonia head to a casting agency to repossess a car from a two-faced receptionist with a special talent for four-letter words.

programme.desc: STARTS 9PM Take a ride along with Operation Repo! This docudrama series takes an in-depth look at the professional, but sometimes murky world of car repossession. Get ready for the drama!
