programme.desc: A powerful storm brings up painful memories of the past - and puts everyone in jeopardy in the present.

programme.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender: Ep 13
programme.desc: When Sokka and Katara get too sick to travel, Aang goes out on his own to find a cure for them. But he is captured by Zhao and held prisoner inside an impenetrable fortress.

programme.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender: Ep 14
programme.desc: Aang, Katara, and Sokka discover a village of people who are all reliant on a fortuneteller in their everyday lives but they are so reliant that they are blind to the imminent danger they are all in.

programme.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender: Ep 15
programme.desc: Aang feels insecure when Katara and Sokka come across something that reminds them of home. Because Aang thinks his friends might leave him, he hides an important message which only leads to trouble.

programme.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender: Ep 16
programme.desc: Aang attempts to find a Firebending master to teach him while Katara learns that she possesses a special power.

programme.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender: Ep 17
programme.desc: After hearing rumors about surviving Airbenders, the kids journey to the Northern Air temple to see for themselves. What they find there could spell disaster for all enemies of the Fire Nation.

programme.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender: Ep 18
programme.desc: The kids reach the Northern Water tribe, and Aang and Katara look for a Waterbending Master as Sokka falls for a princess. Zuko must find a way to continue his quest for the Avatar.

programme.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender: Ep 19
programme.desc: The Northern Water Tribe braces itself for an attack by Admiral Zhao's Fire Navy fleet. Aang struggles to defend the city. He wonders if there isn't a better way to use his Avatar abilities.

programme.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender: Ep 20
programme.desc: Zhao's invasion breaks through the outer wall of the Northern Water Tribe's defenses, and he reveals a sinister plan. Aang goes to the spirit world for help.

programme.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender: Ep 1
programme.desc: Aang and the group meet an Earth Kingdom general who wants to use Aang's powerful `Avatar State' as a weapon to defeat the Fire Nation. But it's more difficult than Aang thinks.

programme.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender: Ep 2
programme.desc: On the way to Omashu, the kids meet some nomads who show them a shortcut through the `cave of two lovers'. When they get lost in the caves, they must trust in love to escape.

programme.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender: Ep 3
programme.desc: The kids return to Omashu so that Aang can learn Earthbending from King Bumi; however, when they get there, they are shocked to find the city is now in Fire Nation hands.

programme.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender: Ep 4
programme.desc: When the kids end up in a mysterious and strange swamp, their fears are exposed. And Aang learns about being `connected to the Earth' from an unlikely teacher.

programme.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender: Ep 5
programme.desc: Aang and the gang discover an Earth town that celebrates `Avatar Day'. They learn that it is not a celebration of the Avatar, but a festival of anger for something Aang did in his past.

programme.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender: Ep 6
programme.desc: In search for an Earthbending teacher for Aang, the kids go to an underground Earthbending tournament where they encounter Toph, a blind, but powerful Earthbender.

programme.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender: Ep 7
programme.desc: Travelling without Uncle now, Zuko wanders alone into an Earth Kingdom town where he bonds with a local boy. Meanwhile, Zuko is haunted by memories of his own youth.

programme.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender: Ep 8
programme.desc: As the kids are pursued relentlessly by a mysterious machine, their exhaustion puts them at each other's throats.

programme.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender: Ep 9
programme.desc: When Aang struggles with a block while trying to learn Earthbending from Toph, he wonders if the problem is with him or his teacher. Meanwhile, Sokka gets himself in a jam.

programme.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender: Ep 10
programme.desc: A professor leads the kids to a spirit library in the middle of the desert, where Sokka hopes to discover powerful secrets to use against the Fire Nation.

programme.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender: Ep 11
programme.desc: Aang searches for Appa, while Katara struggles to keep everyone together so they can survive in the vast desert. Meanwhile, Uncle and Zuko seek help from an ancient secret society.

programme.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender: Ep 12
programme.desc: When the kids can't take the easy way into Ba Sing Se, they must escort a family of refugees there the hard way, through the deadly Serpent's Pass.

programme.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender: Ep 13
programme.desc: Aang discovers a colossal Fire Nation invention heading for Ba Sing Se, and the kids must stop it before it destroys the great wall that protects the city.

programme.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender: Ep 14
programme.desc: Aang and the kids finally arrive in Ba Sing Se to see the Earth King, only to find mysterious forces within the city conspiring to stop them.

programme.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender: Ep 15
programme.desc: A series of short stories that explore the individual adventures of Katara and Toph, Uncle, Sokka, Aang, Zuko, and Momo.

programme.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender: Ep 16
programme.desc: In this special episode, we go back in time to the moment Appa was stolen.

programme.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender: Ep 17
programme.desc: While searching for Appa, the kids run into Jet but are torn about whether to trust him or not. Meanwhile, Zuko also hunts for Appa.

programme.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender: Ep 18
programme.desc: The kids battle Long Feng when they try to show the Earth King the conspiracy taking place in his city. Zuko becomes seriously ill and has odd dreams as he faces a spiritual crisis.

programme.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender: Ep 19
programme.desc: A guru at the Eastern Air Temple helps Aang take the next step in his Avatar journey. Plus, Sokka meets his long-lost father, Azula hatches a diabolical plan, and Uncle and Zuko open a tea shop.

programme.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender: Ep 20
programme.desc: Everyone races against time to stop Azula's sinister conquest of Ba Sing Se. Zuko and Katara spend time together, while Aang's destiny hangs in the balance, as does Zuko's.

programme.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender: Ep 1
programme.desc: After sustaining serious injuries, Aang awakens to find himself aboard a Fire Nation ship. Meanwhile, Zuko journeys home.

programme.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender: Ep 2
programme.desc: To better camouflage themselves as real Fire Nation citizens, the kids check out a Fire Nation school. Also, Zuko confronts Uncle.

programme.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender: Ep 3
programme.desc: The gang arrive at a suffering Fire Nation fishing village, and a mysterious spirit appears to help the villagers.

programme.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender: Ep 4
programme.desc: Sokka feels that he is not contributing enough to the group, and searches for a mysterious master to teach him the ways of the sword.

programme.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender: Ep 5
programme.desc: Zuko, Azula, Mai, and Ty Lee go on vacation at Lo and Li's beach house, where they learn a lot about themselves and each other. Meanwhile, the kids face a new enemy.

programme.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender: Ep 6
programme.desc: Aang and Zuko are taken on parallel adventures that give them insight into their forefathers' pasts, but how does the tale of Roku and Sozin matter to them now?

programme.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender: Ep 7
programme.desc: When Toph discovers a quick way to make cash, Katara disapproves, and the rift between them has disastrous consequences.

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1987): Invasion of the Turtle Snatchers
programme.desc: Donatello and Rocksteady are beamed up to a space ship - by little alien, Nikto, six thousand years old, traveling with his parents Klaatu and Barada.

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1987): Camera Bugged
programme.desc: The polarisoid, an alien tourist visiting Earth, causes all sorts of commotion with his camera which sucks everything it photos literally inside the camera, including City Hall.

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1987): Green with Jealousy
programme.desc: In order to steal nuclear energy from a submarine, Krang creates a love potion which induces lovesickness in all of the Turtles - except Donatello, who does not eat the potion-laced pizza.

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1987): The Return of the Fly
programme.desc: Intent on revenge against both the Turtles, Krang and Shredder, the Fly (alias Baxter Stockman) returns with a bug of a plan. While the Turtles are battling Shredder, the insect tries to exterminate the entire group!

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1987): The Mutagen Monster
programme.desc: The chemicals from two carriages in a train wreck unite to form a mutagen, and steers licking up the goo are transformed into a bull-headed monster.

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1987): Corporate Raiders From Dimension X
programme.desc: Shredder utilizes a hypnotizing device and creates zombies out of CEOs all over the city. Ultimately, the plan is to raise the Technodrome from the centre of the Earth.

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1987): Pizza By The Shred
programme.desc: In order to locate the Turtles' lair and destroy them, Shredder opens a pizza parlour. When the Turtles order a pizza, Shredder places a locator-tracking device on it disguised as an anchovy.

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1987): Super Bebop & Mighty Rocksteady
programme.desc: Krang creates Cybernetic Clones of Rocksteady, only ten times as strong and ten times as smart.

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1987): Blast From the Past
programme.desc: Shredder endeavours to enlist the aid of the ghost of Shibano-Sama, a noble warrior who lived hundreds of years ago, to destroy the Turtles.

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1987): Leatherhead: Terror of the Swamp
programme.desc: The Turtles go south to the swamps when their friends the Frogs -and Napoleon Bonafrog - are in trouble. The source of their predicament is Leatherhead, a half-human, half-alligator mutation.

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1987): Michelangelo's Birthday
programme.desc: It's Michelangelo's birthday - and his good buddies are pretending they're unaware of it.

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1987): Usagi Yojimbo
programme.desc: Shredder's Teleporter, which can teletransport objects to a pre¬≠determined location, interferes with Donatello's transdimensional reception - and Usagi Yojimbo, a 14th century Samurai rabbit, pops out of the Turtles' screen.

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1987): The Case of the Hot Kimono
programme.desc: Agatha Marble helps the Turtles in their pursuit of Don Turtelli, including Splinter's treasured red robe - and holding Happy Hour News' April and Vernon prisoners.
programme.sub-title: The Case of the Hot Kimono

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1987): Usagi, Come Home
programme.desc: Shredder has a hare-brained scheme to turn the rabbit from another dimension, Usagi Yojimbo, into an ally of his and an enemy of the Turtles.

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1987): The Making of Metalhead
programme.desc: Krang creates Metalhead, an exact robot replica of the Turtles with even more powers, and directs him to destroy the Turtles. Donatello, however, reprograms Metalhead over to the Turtles' side.

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1987): Leatherhead Meets the Rat King
programme.desc: Leatherhead The Cajan gator goes into the sewers in pursuit of the Turtles, and encounters the Rat King, who has stolen a tanker¬≠truck of rat poison which he plans to change into a hypnotic gas.

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1987): The Turtle Terminator
programme.desc: Shredder captures Irma and creates an android Irma programmed to destroy the Turtles. The zap-happy robotic Irma causes havoc in the TV newsroom.

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1987): The Great Boldini
programme.desc: Mobster Don Turtelli and his cousin the magician, the Great Baldini, steal the famous Tortellini Emerald.

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1987): The Missing Map
programme.desc: The Turtles are showing Zach, "the fifth Turtle," and his brother Walt their scrapbook.

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1987): The Gang's All Here
programme.desc: Michelangelo falls for a Shredder trick and eats a chocolate chip cookie made with anti-mutagen capable of turning him into a human being.

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1987): The Grybyx
programme.desc: The Neutrinos - Dask, Kala and Zak - are back on Earth in search of Kala's pet Grybyx, a small and cuddly creature that, "mega bizzarro," can turn into a humongous monster.

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1987): Mister Ogg Goes to Town
programme.desc: When Krang realizes the Technodrome is running low on liquid nitrogen, its main source of fuel, he discovers that a formula exists in Dimension Z which transmutes crude oil, easily available on Earth, into liquid nitrogen.

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1987): Shredderville
programme.desc: Because of all the destruction Shredder causes just trying to get rid of the Turtles, they lament that the world would be a better place had they never existed.

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1987): Bye - Bye Fly!
programme.desc: Plotting revenge, Baxter, who has been turned into a fly-like creature, delivers a borellium crystal to Krang and Shredder whose Technodrome is low in power.

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1987): The Big Ripoff
programme.desc: The Technodrome is perilously close to running out of power as it teeters on the edge of a crumbling lava cliff deep within the bowels of the Earth.

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1987): The Big Break-In
programme.desc: Krang and Shredder get the Technodrome rolling again and raise it to the centre of the Earth.

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1987): The Big Blow-Out
programme.desc: Krang and Shredder raise the Technodrome to the surface and seize unlimited energy. The Turtles and the World face their darkest hour.

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1987): Plan Six from Outer Space
programme.desc: The Turtles launch the missile from the sewers positioned under the Technodrome. It transports Bebop, Rocksteady, Krang and Shredder back to Dimension X but explodes on impact; they survive.

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1987): Turtles of the Jungle
programme.desc: Donatello's idol, inventor mad-scientist Professor Willard creates the Molecular Intensifier, a machine to control growth of living things.

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1987): Michelangelo Toys Around
programme.desc: Michelangelo dreams he's being attacked by Tyranno-toys. He wakes up to hear April announcing the Toy Fair opening. Determined to go, Michelangelo disguises himself as a Turtle toy.

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1987): Peking Turtles
programme.desc: April O'Neil reports from the Uptown Museum about a display of artifacts from the 2000-year-old Ying Dynasty of China. The marble warriors were built to protect the world's largest pearl from being stolen from the Emperor's collection of jewels.

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1987): Shredder's Mother
programme.desc: The earth is experiencing global warming and Krang and Shredder threaten to expose it to increased catastrophic weather conditions.

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1987): Four Turtles and A Baby
programme.desc: The Neutrinos are attacked and their leaders, Zenter and Grizzla, are seized by Krang, Shredder and General Traag.

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1987): Turtlemaniac

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1987): Rondo in New York
programme.desc: Word spreads that Oswald Oren, a nerdy Woody Allen-type student, has developed the Vitalizer - an experimental substance that brings inanimate objects to life. Scoundrels Shredder, Krang, Bebop and Rocksteady connive to steal the potion.

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1987): Planet of the Turtles

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1987): Name That Toon

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.desc: Bobby wants to peacefully co-parent with his ex-wife, Andrea, but says she's a liar, & a sex-addict who exposes their son, Kayden, 6, to her lifestyle. He says her bedroom a revolving door of men. Andrea says Bobby is obsessed with ruining her life.
programme.sub-title: Dr. Phil Help Me Escape My Co-Parenting Nightmare!

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.desc: Jean says her 17-year-old daughter, Cheyenne, was the all-American girl , a cheerleader, track star and straight-A honor student until she began dating Josh, a 28-year-old divorced father. Dr. Phil takes a look at Josh's history, should Jean be concerned?
programme.sub-title: He's Nearly 30 And Engaged To My Teen With Braces

programme.title: Dr. Phil

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.desc: Are you the kind of neighbor who loans a cup of sugar and always waves hello, or do you keep to yourself and call the cops the minute you hear loud music? Dr. Phil talks to guests who say they definitely don't live in Mr. Roger's neighborhood!

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.desc: Dr. Phil takes an intense look at the life of Star, a stay-at-home mom who fears that her dangerous habit may take a turn for the worse. Star's 11-year-old daughter, Autumn, sends Dr. Phil a poignant plea for help before tragedy strikes.

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.desc: In a bizarre abuse case, Gypsy Rose Blanchard's mother forced her to pretend she was ill, undergo countless surgeries, shave her head, insert a feeding tube & use a wheelchair. A web of deceit & torture led to murder. Gypsy Rose talks with Dr. Phil.Pt. 1
programme.sub-title: Mother Knows Best: The Story Of Gypsy Rose Pt.1

programme.title: Dr. Phil
programme.desc: Dr. Phil continues his conversation with Trisha, a mother and wife, who is live-streaming her entire life. Find out what caused Trisha to storm off and collapse on stage. Did Dr. Phil almost have to call the paramedics? Pt. 2
programme.sub-title: YouTube Obsessed Trisha's Dramatic Collapse On Stage Pt.2

programme.title: Dr. Phil

programme.desc: Les will be dropped into this inhospitable landscape of Tierra del Fuego, Argentina, the easternmost tip of Isla Grande and left to survive with no food, no shelter, no water, and no safety gear or camera crew.

programme.title: Survivorman: Peru Amazonian Shamans
programme.desc: Les will participate with the Huacharia Tribe as they perform ceremony in their daily lives to pay homage to the elements.

programme.title: Survivorman: Grenada Jungle
programme.desc: Les treks through the thick mountain rainforest to survive on the peak of Grenada's largest active mountain. Mona Monkeys, tarantulas, scorpions, armadillo, parrots and possums all live in this vibrant ecosystem, offering an abundance of food and danger.

programme.title: Survivorman: Plane Crash
programme.desc: For a week, Les will have to survive in the brutally cold and snowy wilderness with only an axe, multi-tool and a single blanket to aid him.

programme.title: Survivorman: Sierra Nevada Search and Rescue
programme.desc: Les finds himself in the predicament of a lost hiker. Travelling with a typical "day hiker" pack ‚Äì only provisions for an overnight stay ‚Äì Les needs to make the most of what he's brought with him.

programme.title: Survivorman: Top Ten
programme.desc: Les reviews his experiences surviving in the wild. While counting down ten wilderness survival issues he has faced, he shows segments of both shows relevant to each item.

programme.title: Survivorman: Tonga
programme.desc: Les strands himself on purpose, accompanied by his long-time survival buddy Bob Wilson, on a deserted island in the Kingdom of Tonga.

programme.title: Survivorman: Giants of the Forest
programme.desc: Les returns to the wilderness of remote Alberta to investigate evidence of Sasquatch activity. Armed with infrared camera and thermal imaging technology, Les investigates reports of Bigfoot sightings in pursuit of the truth.

programme.title: Survivorman: Papua New Guinea
programme.desc: Through the perilous jungle Survivorman treks deep, with the help of a couple of local guides. Led off the beaten path he is deserted alone in this primordial landscape.

programme.title: Survivorman: Arizona Desert
programme.desc: Riding a dirt bike out into the official middle of nowhere, Les simulates a break-down scenario. Half a gallon of water, a snack bar and his multi-tool are all he has with him for the next 7 days.

programme.title: Survivorman: Mexican Desert Island Part 1
programme.desc: Les Stroud is shipwrecked on the desert island of Tiburon. With limited food supplies and no fresh water, Les scavenges to survive on the desert shore.

programme.title: Survivorman: Survivorman & Son Mongolia
programme.desc: Les returns to Mongolia after surviving a near-fatal car crash the year before with his son Logan, a recent cancer survivor.

programme.title: Survivorman: Fan Challenge
programme.desc: For the very first time, Les Stroud takes a fan into the wilderness to survive alongside him, showing him the ropes of what it takes to be Survivorman.

programme.title: Running Wild With Bear Grylls: 7 Celebrities,7 Days, 7 Craziest Challenges with Bear Grylls starting: Nick Jonas
programme.desc: Renowned survivalist Bear Grylls is accompanied by singer Nick Jonas on another one of his journeys into the wilderness.
programme.sub-title: 7 Celebrities,7 Days, 7 Craziest Challenges with Bear Grylls starting: Nick Jonas

programme.title: Running Wild With Bear Grylls: Bear Grylls, Keri Russell
programme.desc: Keri Russell and Bear journey through the Canary Islands; they dine on undigested seeds from a pigeon carcass, use a grappling hook and make a daring escape from a mountain peak using a paraglider; Keri discusses her family and path to fame.

programme.title: Running Wild With Bear Grylls: Bear Grylls, Mel B
programme.desc: Spice Girl Mel B joins Bear on the two hundred foot cliffs of the Welsh coastline, where a final descent sends Mel into breakdown mode; Bear is stung by a jellyfish, forcing Mel to practice some first aid skills.

programme.title: JAG: Trinity
programme.desc: Harm and his new partner, Marine Major Sara MacKenzie are drawn into a game of revenge when they're sent to Belfast, Ireland, to represent the legal interests of a Navy Lieutenant whose infant son has seemingly been abducted.

programme.title: JAG: Secrets
programme.desc: Admiral Chegwidden, Mac and Bud Roberts are taken hostage in the Admiral's office by Pvt. Magida, a Marine who escaped from a nearby Federal prison.

programme.title: JAG: Ghosts
programme.desc: Harm and Mac investigate an attempt on Admiral Chedwiggen's life and uncover the fact that all the members of his former SEAL team have died under mysterious circumstances.

programme.title: JAG: Full Engagement
programme.desc: While on their day off, Harm takes Mac for a flight in his vintage airplane, only to be forced to make an emergency landing in a mountain clearing because of mechanical problems.

programme.title: JAG: Cowboys and Cossaks
programme.desc: Harm, Mac, and Bud are assigned sea duty to monitor a joint war games exercise between U.S. and Russian naval forces.

programme.title: JAG: The Guardian
programme.desc: Harm and Mac defend Bauwer, a former Navy Seal, now a homeless man, who's accused of using excessive force when he killed three men who tried to hold up a convenience store.

programme.title: JAG: Rendevous
programme.desc: Mac and Harm once again find themselves courtroom adversaries as Mac is assigned the difficult task of defending CPO Holst, an admitted wife abuser accused of murdering his wife's boyfriend.

programme.title: JAG: Ghost Ship
programme.desc: Harm and Mac investigate the discovery of a skeleton found hidden aboard a decommissioned aircraft carrier that is being cut up for scrap, and learn it is all that remains of a long-missing JAG officer.

programme.title: JAG: The Court Martial of Sandra Gilbert
programme.desc: The top female gunship pilot at the Yuma Marine Base is charged with disobeying an order to stop "fraternizing" with her crew chief, a married, enlisted man. Mac is assigned as prosecutor and Harm is set as Susan's defense attorney.
programme.sub-title: The Court Martial of Sandra Gilbert

programme.title: JAG: Vanished
programme.desc: Concerns regarding the mysterious disappearance of a fully armed Navy F-14 during a storm lead Harm's investigation to consider such diverse scenarios as pilot suicide, terrorism, the Bermuda Triangle curse, or UFO interference.

programme.title: JAG: King of the Fleas
programme.desc: Having just stabbed a man on a street-corner, Willie, a wheelchair-bound former Vietnam POW arrives at JAG headquarters to report "a 30-year-old murder" which he's just committed. Willie relates that while imprisoned he knew Harm's father.

programme.title: JAG: Against All Enemies
programme.desc: Harm, Mac and Bud board an aircraft carrier in the Sea of Japan to investigate the accidental shooting down of a North Korean civilian airliner by Navy jets.

programme.title: JAG: Impact
programme.desc: Harm and Bud investigate the crash of a Marine helicopter whose dead pilot is being blamed for the incident. They discover the chopper seems to have been hit by some form of UFO. Government security officials want to maintain a cover-up at all costs.

programme.title: JAG: People V. Rabb
programme.desc: Harm is arrested by the FBI for the murder of Konaplanik, a Russian who was selling Harm supposedly accurate information about his missing father's whereabouts. The killer turns out to be Col. Tomashevsky, a Russian agent.

programme.title: JAG: Defensless
programme.desc: A woman Navy ensign shoots and kills a Turkish colonel; she claims self-defense.

programme.title: JAG: With Intent to Die
programme.desc: With help from Harm, Mac, Harriet, and Bud, Admiral Chedwiggen investigates the apparent suicide of his mentor, Admiral Clancy, who allegedly shot himself while on a hunting trip. Harm and company ultimately uncover who the killer was.

programme.title: JAG: Father's Day
programme.desc: Mac and Harm are assigned the task of defending a young Marine whose frustration at being unable to wrest custody of his son has led to his being court-martialed for dereliction of duty.

programme.title: JAG: Tiger, Tiger
programme.desc: Harm takes Josh on a weekend cruise for Navy families aboard a frigate. When the frigate is taken over by terrorists who intend to fire missiles at Cuba, Harm and Bud take matters into their own hands to stop the evil plot.

programme.title: The Love Boat: The Tomorrow Lady/ Father, Dear Father/ Still Life
programme.desc: A woman's (Greer Garson) ability to see the future may hinder her relationship with an attractive man. Plus, a single mother thinks she meets a divorced man traveling with his daughter, but that's not exactly the case.
programme.sub-title: The Tomorrow Lady/ Father, Dear Father/ Still Life

programme.title: The Love Boat: The Christmas Presence
programme.desc: Angelorum Dominicus suddenly appears aboard the Pacific Princess without a reservation and soon begins to spread love and happiness to everyone on the cruise, especially a little boy in need of an operation.

programme.title: The Love Boat: The Groupies/ The Audition/ Doc'S Nephew
programme.desc: A female producer is adamant about not wanting to start a relationship with an actor, but the thespian has other plans. Meanwhile, a therapist goes on a cruise with his group, while Doc and his nephew compete for the affection of the same woman.
programme.sub-title: The Groupies/ The Audition/ Doc'S Nephew

programme.title: The Love Boat: The Captain's Replacement/ Sly As A Fox/ Here Comes The Bride -- Maybe
programme.desc: When Gopher suspects a skipper under Capt. Stubing's tutelage is trying to take his job, the crew jumps into action to protect their boss. Meanwhile, a lovely lady causes havoc when she boards with two men who are each after her hand.
programme.sub-title: The Captain's Replacement/ Sly As A Fox/ Here Comes The Bride -- Maybe

programme.title: The Love Boat: Gopher's Daisy/ Our Son, The Lawyer/ Salvaged Romance
programme.desc: A woman's (Joan Rivers) shyness around men is exacerbated by her recent mastectomy that is until she meets an understanding man. Meanwhile, when a married couple contemplates divorce, it's their son, who's also a lawyer, that gets caught in the middle.
programme.sub-title: Gopher's Daisy/ Our Son, The Lawyer/ Salvaged Romance

programme.title: The Love Boat: Fountain Of Youth/ Bad Luck Cabin/ Uncle Daddy
programme.desc: When an elderly man's granddaughter falls for one of his fresh-faced friends, the man seeks out some of the youth potion for himself. Meanwhile, things start moving a little too fast for Isaac and the woman he's dating.
programme.sub-title: Fountain Of Youth/ Bad Luck Cabin/ Uncle Daddy

programme.title: The Love Boat: The Professor Has Class/ When The Magic Disappears/ We, The Jury
programme.desc: A sarcastic woman (Anne Meara) goes on a rampage when she finds out she's on a cruise with the same man she's suing (Jerry Stiller) for damages. Meanwhile, a famous professor meets a former student who is hired to replace his mentor/
programme.sub-title: The Professor Has Class/ When The Magic Disappears/ We, The Jury

programme.title: The Love Boat: The Captain's Crush/ Out Of My Hair/ Off-Course Romance
programme.desc: When Stubing meets a gorgeous movie queen (Joan Collins), who recently shed her ninth husband, he is fascinated by her charm and beauty. Then, a man decides to prioritize golf over his wife, so the neglected woman decides to play ball with an old friend.
programme.sub-title: The Captain's Crush/ Out Of My Hair/ Off-Course Romance

programme.title: The Love Boat: Discount Romance/ Vicky'S Dilemma/ Loser, And Still Champ
programme.desc: The captain's daughter is put in a tough situation she is accused of stealing supplements from Doc's office. Then, Gopher's uncle (Red Button) falls in love with the lady who runs the ship's gift shop.
programme.sub-title: Discount Romance/ Vicky'S Dilemma/ Loser, And Still Champ

programme.title: The Love Boat: So Help Me Hannah/ The Maid Cleans Up/ Cpr, I.O.U
programme.desc: The vivacious Hannah Harvye (Mary Martin) immediately becomes involved with the crew and rekindles a romance with an old flame. An unassuming man (Ben Murphy) finds himself in a tight situation with a maid he's never met. Gopher saves a man's life.
programme.sub-title: So Help Me Hannah/ The Maid Cleans Up/ Cpr, I.O.U

programme.title: The Love Boat: Love Boat - The World's Greatest Kisser/ Don'T Take My Wife, Please/ The Reluctant Father
programme.desc: A jilted fiance hires a Mata Hari (Elaine Joyce) to find the crew member that ruined his wedding plans; a junior executive (Parker Stevenson) suffers in silence while his boss (David Doyle) lusts after his bride.
programme.sub-title: Love Boat - The World's Greatest Kisser/ Don'T Take My Wife, Please/ The Reluctant Father

programme.title: The Love Boat: Affair On Demand/ Friend Of The Family/ Just Another Pretty Face
programme.desc: A married couple finds out that their daughter is in love with the father's best friend, while a progressive woman agrees to help her romantic partner have an affair.
programme.sub-title: Affair On Demand/ Friend Of The Family/ Just Another Pretty Face

programme.title: The Love Boat: Rhino Of The Year/ One Last Time/ For Love Or Money

programme.sub-title: Rhino Of The Year/ One Last Time/ For Love Or Money

programme.title: The Love Boat: Bricker's Boy/ Lotions Of Love/ The Hustlers
programme.desc: The professional escort of an older woman (Vera Miles) dallies with a young woman (Constance Forslund); an advertising whiz tries to impress his best client despite putdowns from her daughter.
programme.sub-title: Bricker's Boy/ Lotions Of Love/ The Hustlers

programme.title: The Love Boat: The Misunderstanding/ Love Below Decks/ The End Is Near
programme.desc: An estranged mother and daughter mend their relationship after a secret about their past is revealed. Then, an attractive widow finds herself falling for a burly crew member.
programme.sub-title: The Misunderstanding/ Love Below Decks/ The End Is Near

programme.title: The Love Boat: Julie's Blind Date/ Dee Dee's Dilemma/ The Prizewinner
programme.desc: An author (Tom Poston) is blackmailed by his secretary; a father and son (Geoffrey Scott, Clark Brandon) unwittingly fall for the same woman (Markie Post).
programme.sub-title: Julie's Blind Date/ Dee Dee's Dilemma/ The Prizewinner

programme.title: The Love Boat: Youth Takes A Holiday/ Don't Leave Home Without It/ Prisoner Of Love
programme.desc: An Army captain (Beth Howland) sets her sights on Gopher; a married couple (Charlotte Rae, Louis Nye) meet up with two swingers (Jamie Farr, Heather Locklear).
programme.sub-title: Youth Takes A Holiday/ Don't Leave Home Without It/ Prisoner Of Love

programme.title: The Love Boat: Love On Strike/ Looking For Mr. Wilson/ The Last Case
programme.desc: Everyone is a suspect when a passenger goes missing about the Pacific Princess. Meanwhile, when Julie's high-school friend boards the ship with her son, they learn an important lesson after running into the woman's father and another passenger.
programme.sub-title: Love On Strike/ Looking For Mr. Wilson/ The Last Case

programme.title: Melrose Place: The Brooke Stops Here
programme.desc: Michael moves out after Sydney accosts him for trying to take advantage of Jane. Monty asks Jake to collect from another of his "customers" to pay off his interest, but Jake cannot go through with it.

programme.title: Melrose Place: Sydney, Bothered And Bewildered
programme.desc: Alison tries to show some sensitivity toward Brooke, who responds by trashing Alison's apartment. Michael agrees to come home from Peter's if Sydney can get Jane out of the beach house.

programme.title: Melrose Place: The Bobby Trap
programme.desc: Vince is furious when he learns that Bobby did not kill Amanda. Michael injects Kimberly with truth serum and gets her to admit that Sydney drugged Jane.

programme.title: Melrose Place
programme.desc: Peter pays Syd to accompany him to a party and try to win Bobby away from Amanda. Sydney warns Bobby that Peter is out to destroy his relationship with Amanda.

programme.title: Melrose Place: Devil In a Wet Dress
programme.desc: Billy is haunted by nightmares about Brooke. Michael goes to great lengths to convince Kimberly to move back in with him.

programme.title: Melrose Place: The Circle Of Strife
programme.desc: Kimberly is hurt when she receives divorce papers, although they had been filed months before her reconciliation with Michael. Sydney sues Michael and Peter for sexual harassment, and they are forced to appoint her office manager.

programme.title: Melrose Place: Run Billy Run
programme.desc: Amanda agrees to give Billy a raise if he can win a prestigious airline account. He sleeps with a rival executive to get her to reveal their strategy, then uses it to undermine them.

programme.title: Melrose Place: Ruthless People
programme.desc: Billy continues to irritate Alison with his win-at-all-costs attitude and boorish behavior. A distraught Matt gets drunk and sleeps with his friend Dave.

programme.title: Melrose Place: The Burning Sofa

programme.title: Melrose Place: Triumph Of The Bill
programme.desc: S04E026) Billy uses underhanded means to steal the keynote speech at an ad convention away from Alison. Claire has been hired by Richard to break up Jake and Jane.

programme.title: Melrose Place: What Goes Up, Must Come Down

programme.sub-title: What Goes Up, Must Come Down

programme.title: Melrose Place: Melrose Unglued

programme.title: Melrose Place: Full Metal Betsy
programme.desc: Michael and Amanda hit the road in search of Peter and Kimberly. Jane blackmails Sydney into participating in her plot to murder Richard.

programme.title: Melrose Place: Dear Sisters Walking
programme.desc: Peter is saved from the lobotomy when Michael and Amanda break into the hospital, but "Betsy" captures them and locks them in the boiler room. Peter is arrested for Bobby's murder.

programme.title: Melrose Place: Living With Disaster

programme.title: Little Bear

programme.title: Little Bear

programme.title: Little Bear
programme.desc: When Pompon wants all the attention to focus on him, he puts a bandage on his finger, pretending that he has a cut. But Rita will not be fooled. She knows exactly what he's up to.

programme.title: Masha and the Bear

programme.title: Masha and the Bear

programme.desc: Realizing that he hasn‚Äôt won any Gym badges for a while, Ash signs up for the Pok√©mon League Admissions Exam, a great chance to prove he‚Äôs got what it takes to become a Pok√©mon Master!

programme.title: Pokemon: Indigo League
programme.desc: Ash and the gang decide to check out a breeding center that they saw on a commercial. However, the center is a cover for a diabolical scheme from Team Rocket members Butch and Cassidy‚Äîold rivals of Jessie and James!

programme.title: Pokemon: Adventures in the Orange Islands
programme.desc: Misty and Jessie compete to be Queen of the Princess Festival! Ash and Brock lend Misty their Pok√©mon for the battle, and Jessie takes a licking despite a surprise Pok√©mon of her own.

programme.title: Pokemon: Adventures in the Orange Islands
programme.desc: It‚Äôs Kids Day, and Ash and friends help some schoolchildren celebrate. Team Rocket spoils the fun by grabbing a kid instead of Pikachu. In a shocking turn of events, Meowth becomes a good guy‚Ä¶or does he?

programme.title: Pokemon: Adventures in the Orange Islands
programme.desc: Our heroes travel to Cinnabar Island, where Ash hopes to win the Volcano Badge. A strange character offers riddles about how to find the Gym, where Ash and Pikachu have a fiery battle with a Pok√©mon they‚Äôve never seen before!

programme.title: Pokemon: Adventures in the Orange Islands
programme.desc: Ash has finally located the Gym, suspended above a pool of molten lava! This battle for the Volcano Badge can only be won by a strong Fire-type Pok√©mon, so Ash must rely on his misbehaving Charizard.

programme.title: Pokemon: Adventures in the Orange Islands
programme.desc: While Ash and the gang hurry to catch the last ferry off Cinnabar Island, they get sidetracked by a group of Squirtle, Wartortle, and Blastoise that need assistance!

programme.title: Pokemon: Adventures in the Orange Islands
programme.desc: Misty's Horsea desperately needs exercise, so the gang decides to take it to her sisters' Gym in Cerulean City. There, she learns that her sisters are planning an exciting underwater ballet.

programme.title: Sister, Sister: The Grass Is Always Finer
programme.desc: Tia's crush on a handsome teacher leaves her shaken, stirred, and on the rocks with her boyfriend.

programme.title: Sister, Sister: Bum Rap
programme.desc: Tia's experiment has Jordan and Tyreke at each other's throats, while Tamera and her dad face off in a political showdown!

programme.title: Sister, Sister: Domino Effect
programme.desc: Jordan and Tyreke find themselves escorting two young coeds to the Homecoming Dance --- until girlfriends Tia and Tamera decide to show up at the last minute!

programme.title: Sister, Sister: Greek To Me
programme.desc: Tia faces a tough choice among competing sororities; while Jordan also learns a lesson about the Greek.

programme.title: Sister, Sister: My Father's House
programme.desc: Jordan confronts his fears when Tamera and friends convince him that love is a two-way street.

programme.title: Sister, Sister: For The People
programme.desc: Ray is frustrated that his political campaign is not allowing him the time to get to the heart of the issues with his constituents. His campaign manager has been driving Ray hard, and the results are starting to make an impact.

programme.title: Sister, Sister: Twins Or Consequences
programme.desc: Tia gets cold feet after agreeing to take an exam for her twin sister.

programme.title: Sister, Sister: Mixed Doubles
programme.desc: It's a game of musical dates as the girls' family and friends switch partners for a night on the town.

programme.title: Sister, Sister: Two Guys, A Girl, and a Calendar
programme.desc: Tia and Tamera battle it out on behalf of their guys as competition gets tight for a spot in their school's 12 Most Gorgeous Men on Campus calendar.
programme.sub-title: Two Guys, A Girl, and a Calendar

programme.title: Sister, Sister: Sweet Talk
programme.desc: Tamera lands a job as a radio talk show hostess dispensing advice on love on romance, including her own sister Tia's -- but without Tia's permission!

programme.title: Sister, Sister: Father's Day
programme.desc: The twins think a photojournalist visiting campus may be their biological father.

programme.title: Sister, Sister: I Know What You Did In Drama Class
programme.desc: Diavian and Tyreke become partners in drama class but Tia flips out after catching them in a passionate kiss during a drama rehearsal. Tamera and Jordan try to hook up cable in the girl's room
programme.sub-title: I Know What You Did In Drama Class

programme.title: Sister, Sister: Double Talk
programme.desc: Jordan's guest shot on Tamera's radio show turns into a full-time gig, but it may cost them their friendship.

programme.title: Sister, Sister: Freaknik
programme.desc: Tia, Tamera, and Diavian all go to FreakNik in Atlanta during Spring Break. Tyreke races to Atlanta hoping to make up with Tia, but it may not be in time to save their relationship.

programme.title: Sister, Sister: Before There Was Hip-Hop
programme.desc: An old-time jazz legend fuels dreams of the swing era for the class and dreams of heroics for Jordan.

programme.title: Sister, Sister: Let Them Eat Cupcake
programme.desc: A series of mix-ups delays Victor's marriage proposal to Lisa

programme.title: Sister, Sister: The Road Less Traveled
programme.desc: Tia considers taking a summer internship with the WNBA in New York. Meanwhile, Lisa worries about her upcoming wedding.

programme.title: Sister, Sister: Fly Away Home
programme.desc: Lisa gets cold feet on her wedding day, while Tia and Tamera entertain an anxious crowd waiting for the ceremony.

programme.title: Sister, Sister: The Meeting
programme.desc: Once separated at birth, identical twins Tia and Tamera, rediscover each other and scheme to live under one roof with their adoptive parents, who have nothing in common but their love for the girls.

programme.title: Sister, Sister: First Dates
programme.desc: Tia and Tamera vie for dates to the big school dance, while Ray and Lisa clash over the rules of the house.

programme.title: Sister, Sister: Slumber Party
programme.desc: The boyfriend of one of Tia and Tamera's slumber party guests crashes the bash, while Lisa discovers that her beau is stepping out with another woman.

programme.title: Sister, Sister: Cheater Cheater
programme.desc: Tamera cajoles Tia into helping her cheat on a test in order to win Ray's approval.

programme.title: Sister, Sister: Wedding Bells & Box Boys
programme.desc: Lisa blames Ray for leading a bridal client astray, while Tia and Tamera see Roger in a whole new light during a double date.

programme.title: Sister, Sister: Out Alone
programme.desc: While taking a bus to the movies, Tia and Tamera fight over the disadvantages of being a twin, but when they get lost, they must team up to find their way home.

programme.title: Sister, Sister: The Pimple
programme.desc: When a pimple pops up just before Tia's big date, Tamera agrees to step in for her -- and finds herself falling for Tia's guy.

programme.title: Sister, Sister: Car Trouble
programme.desc: Tamera scratches the fender of her father's prized car, then tries to hide the truth with the help of Tia and Roger.

programme.title: Sister, Sister: The Birthday
programme.desc: The twins' first birthday together leaves Tamera's best friend feeling left out, and Ray locked in an argument with Lisa over his parenting methods.

programme.title: Sister, Sister: Love Strikes
programme.desc: Fearing they'll be separated forever if Ray and Lisa marry other people, Tia and Tamera plot to derail Ray's new romance.

programme.title: Sister, Sister: Mothers & Other Strangers
programme.desc: When Lisa's disapproving mother comes for a visit, Ray agrees to pose as her husband.

programme.title: Sister, Sister: The Concert
programme.desc: After their parents forbid them to attend a rap concert, the twins sneak out of the house to meet their idol anyway.

programme.title: Sister, Sister: Hair Today
programme.desc: Tamera's glamorous new look gets her into a snobby clique -- but threatens her relationship with Tia, who's been snubbed by the same crowd.

programme.title: Sister, Sister: Get a Job
programme.desc: Bored with their jobs at Ray's limousine company, the twins secretly start working at a burger stand and quickly learn the perils of trying to be in two places at the same time.

programme.title: Sister, Sister: Joeys Choice
programme.desc: Tia and Tamera face "double trouble" when the same guy unknowingly asks them both out on the same date!

programme.title: Sister, Sister: A Tall Tale
programme.desc: Prom night could wind up being a date with disaster when Tia and Tamera's escorts behave badly, and Roger's date towers over him.

programme.title: Sister, Sister: Its a Love Thang
programme.desc: Love is in the air when Tamera, Lisa, and Ray all have close encounters of the romantic kind.

programme.title: Sister, Sister: Free Billy
programme.desc: Tia and Tamera rescue a pig who's being mistreated by its owner and attempt to secretly stash the "porker" at home.

programme.title: Sister, Sister
programme.desc: While recovering from "twin appendectomies," Tia and Tamera go in search of hospital records that could reveal the identities of their biological parents.

programme.title: Flashpoint
programme.desc: Team One has to rescue a doctor, but as they search Sam discovers a child in critical need of medical attention, and realizes that being taken hostage may be the only way to save him.

programme.title: Flashpoint
programme.desc: Team One believes they are stopping a robbery in progress unaware that part of the robbers' plan is to escape their cruel leader. Their plan could make them his next victims and the team has to try to keep the robbers from harm.

programme.title: Flashpoint
programme.desc: Team One discovers that they need to take new security measures to protect the system they use to follow crimes after they are given acces to a crime about to happen.

programme.title: Flashpoint
programme.desc: Team One's efforts to save a kidnapped woman's life are dependent in large part on the abductor's brother, who holds a dark family secret.

programme.title: Flashpoint
programme.desc: Team One confronts a man desperate to keep the promise he made to his deaf nephew by protecting the only place the boy has ever felt safe.

programme.title: Flashpoint
programme.desc: The team is called in when a car bomb explodes at a kid's birthday party. As it turns out the victim of the explosion was the head of a local biker community which is already under investigation.

programme.title: Flashpoint
programme.desc: The team tries to help a young man with amazing memory who is taken hostage to help get to a weapon with smart bullets which can shoot a target even behind cover.

programme.title: Flashpoint
programme.desc: Jules and Sam receive some personal news, but don't know whether to share it with the team.
programme.sub-title: We Take Care of Our Own

programme.title: Flashpoint
programme.desc: Ed and Greg's sons come for a ride along and disobey a direct order from Sergeant Parker when he tells them to remain in the truck while Team One deals with an incident between three cops on an off-the-books mission to clean up the streets.

programme.title: Flashpoint
programme.desc: Team One is called in when an Emotionally Disturbed Person kidnaps his neighbor's baby, thinking it's his own daughter, and takes refuge on a ferry.

programme.title: Flashpoint
programme.desc: Team One faces the most challenging call of their careers when a series of bombs tears the city apart.

programme.title: Flashpoint
programme.desc: Team One continues the hunt for a bomber at large as team members, joined by EMS and the military, split up to deal with multiple bomb threats in a city already plunged into chaos.

programme.title: Flashpoint
programme.desc: When a disturbed man takes a woman hostage outside an office building, the SRU is quick to respond to save the innocent hostage and bystanders caught in the crossfire.

programme.title: Flashpoint
programme.desc: After a desperate father puts his own life on the line to save his daughter's life, Sgt. Parker is forced to confront his feelings about his own child

programme.title: Flashpoint
programme.desc: When the SRU team raids a drug dealer, things quickly go south as an innocent bystander finds himself in the middle of a gun fight.

programme.title: Flashpoint
programme.desc: The SRU team must set aside their personal beliefs when they go to save a cop who is being held hostage by an enraged family member.

programme.title: Flashpoint
programme.desc: When the SRU arrives at a hostage situation at a bank, Sgt. Parker faces one of his toughest negotiations when the robber isn't who he thought.

programme.title: Flashpoint
programme.desc: Teenage gang members are out for revenge after a distressed classmate accuses one of their boyfriends of rape.

programme.title: Flashpoint
programme.desc: When the SRU responds to a violent altercation between a young man and his father, the boy flees the police and runs into the woods, sending the team on a manhunt

programme.title: Flashpoint
programme.desc: When a young man holds a courtroom hostage in an attempt to clear his name for a crime he didn't commit, an SRU team member is in the wrong place at the wrong time and must find a way to safely defuse a critical situation.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Tubbies play a bumping bottoms game. They stop to watch some children play some ball games. Laa-Laa‚Äôs ball goes in a puddle, she tries to get it back but can‚Äôt reach it.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies watch some children mixing water, paint and washing up liquid to make bubble pictures. Po shows us how to make Tubby Custard before running off to watch three ships sail through Teletubbyland.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: A voice trumpet rises to say "Meow". The Tubbies watch three boys play with their new kittens. A voice trumpet rises and announces that it is 'Time to get up.' But the Teletubbies are too tired and go back to bed.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Tubbies watch an international Christmas insert. Laa-Laa makes a snowball. Her snowball begins to roll and it gets bigger and bigger.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: Po say's "Eh-oh" and runs off to join the other Tubbies when they watch Andy Brown and some children go on a boat trip to feed some sealions. The Tubbies are very busy at the switch panel, pressing buttons and pushing levers.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies watch some children who love to skip. In Teletubbyland, the Teletubbies practice skipping. To begin with they‚Äôre not very good, but after lots of practice, they skip all over Teletubbyland.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies pop up to say hello. The Teletubbies watch some children making hay. A tree appears in Teletubbyland and the Noo-Noo tidies up all the Teletubbies favourite things.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: A little boy‚Äôs daddy is a policeman, he shows us his uniform and badges. The Teletubbies are sitting at their table when they hear a funny noise.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies are having some Tubby Custard when they stop to watch some children who are going strawberry picking.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies watch a little girl making breakfast for her mum. Laa-Laa and Po wake up and play a great game saying ‚ÄòGood Morning‚Äô to each other.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: Dipsy goes for a walk and sees lots of things in Teletubbyland. The Teletubbies watch as Andy Brown shows some children a rockpool. There's time for one more dance before Tubby Bye Bye.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies watch children making a boat they then put it in a paddling pool to see if it will float. Tinky Winky‚Äôs bag falls in a puddle.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies watch some children learn about the number three. Tinky Winky, Dipsy and Laa-Laa go for a walk. They count three trees and three flowers and Po follows behind counting too.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies watch some children go for a ride on a Sea Tractor. Po goes for a ride on her scooter, while she‚Äôs riding she sees Laa-Laa‚Äôs ball, Dipsy‚Äôs hat and Tinky Winky‚Äôs bag. They‚Äôve left them all behind!

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies watch some children crawling. In Teletubbyland, the Teletubbies are crawling. Tinky Winky crawled along the path, Dipsy crawled over the hill, Laa-Laa crawled between the trees and Po crawled around the flowers.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: A voice trumpet rises and the Teletubbies run out of the house to listen to the Woof Woof sounds. The Teletubbies copy the sounds again and again.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies watch three boys fill a sand pendulum and make a picture. Tinky Winky, Dipsy and Laa-Laa follow Po everywhere. The animals march through Teletubbyland, before it is time for Tubby Bye-Bye.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies appear on the hills for a big hug. The run off to watch a lady tell some children an Indian story about a clever fox. The Lion and Bear appear in Teletubbyland.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: Po counts to three. The Teletubbies watch Sam have a ride in a helicopter. Laa-Laa's ball gets stuck up a tree and three magic ships sail through Teletubbyland.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: Dipsy is out for a walk when a strong wind blows his hat away. The hat disappears into Home Hill, but Dipsy doesn't know where it has gone. Noo Noo blows the hat back out of Home Hill to Dipsy, who is very happy.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies watch two children looking through a telescope at the moon. In Teletubbyland, Po is going round and round.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies play a hello and goodbye game in the hills. They watch a little boy look for a chameleon in the garden

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: A balloon appears in Teletubbyland; it floats in the air. The Teletubbies follow the balloon all over Teletubbyland, but they can't catch it.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: Teletubbies lobe to play peek-a-boo. The Teletubbies watch some children painting pictures. When a book appears in Teletubbyland, something magic happens when Dipsy turns the pages.

programme.desc: The Teletubbies watch some children dancing while King Pleasure and the Biscuit Boys play Hickory Dickory Dock. A voice trumpet appears and sings Hickory Dickory Dock.

programme.desc: A crucified body dated back to the first century A.D is uncovered at an ancient cave in Jerusalem. Trouble ensues as word spreads.

programme.title: Inside Out
programme.desc: After being released from prison after serving 13 years for manslaughter, AJ‚Äôs dreams of living a pleasant crime-free life soon come to an end when he discovers his closest childhood friend Jack, has been marked for death.

programme.title: Love Potion #9
programme.desc: Paul, a geek biochemist with no luck at all with women, is persuaded by his friends to visit a gypsy. She gives him "Love Potion #9", an elixir which can potentially force anyone of the opposite sex to instantly fall in love with him.

programme.title: Seize The Day
programme.desc: Tommy Wilhelm is a good honest man who's fallen on hard times after losing his job, but what really gets to Tommy is seeing both his friends and family turning their backs on him one after the other. He tries to seize the day - in vain.

programme.title: Sabrina The Animated Series: Paranormal Pi

programme.title: Sabrina The Animated Series: Anywhere But Here

programme.title: Sabrina The Animated Series: Documagicary

programme.title: Sabrina The Animated Series: The Grandparent Trap
programme.desc: When Sabrina hears that her Grandparents are coming for visit she is excited. They have a important announcement to make.

programme.title: Sabrina The Animated Series: I Got Glue Babe

programme.title: Tales from the Cryptkeeper: Fare Tonight

programme.title: Earth: Final Conflict: The Once and Future World
programme.desc: Artifacts believed to be Taelon are found in South America. Renee and Liam try to beat Sandoval to the source to determine the importance of the found pieces.

programme.title: Earth: Final Conflict: Thicker than Blood
programme.desc: An old business partner of Augur's is hired by Da'an to get information about the Resistance, resulting in the death of many members. Meanwhile, Sandoval finds out he has a life threatening blood disorder.

programme.title: Earth: Final Conflict: A Little Bit of Heaven
programme.desc: Liam and Renee investigate a dead pregnant woman missing her fetus. They discover a town that Da'an helped after a nuclear meltdown and a suspicious brother and sister who were part of an early experiment to combine human and Taelon DNA.

programme.title: Earth: Final Conflict: Pad'ar
programme.desc: Pad'ar is a fierce battle game where spectators can connect via a "jack patch" that Liam suspects is causing neurological damage to users. When a Pad'ar warrior dies, it raises even more questions about the safety.

programme.title: Earth: Final Conflict: In Memory
programme.desc: Lili wakes up, supposedly on Earth after a coma, and is told the Jaridians have come and conquered the Taelons. She remembers Sandoval telling her she no longer has and Earth-based physiology and believes things are not as they seem.

programme.title: Earth: Final Conflict: The Cloister
programme.desc: Zo'or and Da'an travel to a cloister for an energy sharing ceremony, but one of the sisters is killed and everyone is a suspect.

programme.title: Earth: Final Conflict: Interview
programme.desc: Zo'or agrees to do a live television interview to try to endear himself to humans, but the show's producer has an ulterior motive in getting him in front of a camera.

programme.title: Earth: Final Conflict: Keep Your Enemies Closer
programme.desc: The shuttle Liam and Zo'or are in crashes over wilderness, but survive in safety bubbles. The people they meet live off the earth and know nothing of the Taelons. However, Zo'or is injured and missing a Synod meeting on the mother ship.

programme.title: Earth: Final Conflict: Subterfuge
programme.desc: Sandoval has a mole attempting to gain information about Liam - particularly concerning his commitment to the Taelons. When a Taelon and protector are killed in a portal that malfunctions, Liam is suspicious that it was intentional.

programme.title: Earth: Final Conflict: Scorched Earth
programme.desc: Bombings begin at embassies and Liam believes they may reignite the SI (Sino-Indian) War, which ended with an armistice several years before. An old intelligence agency friend of Renee's has interesting holographic technology.

programme.title: Earth: Final Conflict: Sanctuary
programme.desc: Liam Kincaid races against the clock to find Zo'or, who disappears after contracting an ancient Taelon virus that has the potential to cause a devastating plague.

programme.title: Earth: Final Conflict: Through Your Eyes
programme.desc: Zo'or kidnaps a comatose policeman in order to use the man's body as a 'vessel' in a consciousness transfer experiment that will allow him to 'test' the human survival instinct and cause havoc on Earth.

programme.title: Earth: Final Conflict: Time Bomb
programme.desc: While examining Ma'el's ship, Liam and Renee find a chamber and in it are some life pods and the persons are all dead except for one.

programme.title: Earth: Final Conflict: The Fields
programme.desc: Liam investigates a mission run by the Church of the Companions when a friend of his disappears. Sandoval and the Taelons are concerned about "the fields" where something vital to the Taelons' survival is harvested.

programme.title: Earth: Final Conflict: Apparition
programme.desc: Liam investigates the suspicious death of a banker, which he saw in a dream. It seems to be an exiled Taelon spirit that is contacting him. Da'an berates Zo'or for his money and power hungry attitude.

programme.title: Earth: Final Conflict: One Taelon Avenue
programme.desc: Joshua Doors is running his own technology development company and Renee goes undercover to find out what is going on. An artificial intelligence program of the Taelons that controls human minds seems to be acting on its own.

programme.title: Earth: Final Conflict: Abduction
programme.desc: A volunteer who was working to interpret an ancient message from Ma'el assaults Da'an and escapes through a portal. Sandoval helps Da'an avoid interrogation from Zo'or while they try to locate her.

programme.title: Earth: Final Conflict: Arrival
programme.desc: A Taelon shuttle is shot down over Antarctica. There are Jiridians aboard, but two of the passengers escape. When Augur discovers Lili's blood on the ship, he is convinced that she is not dead.

programme.title: Earth: Final Conflict: The Forge of Creation
programme.desc: Lili, Vorjak, and the baby flee to find a shuttle to escape Earth. Liam and Sandoval are both tracking them - for different reasons. Augur is on the run from volunteers, but sends a friend (Juliet) to help Liam while he's gone.

programme.title: Earth: Final Conflict: First Breath
programme.desc: A college friend of Renee's resurfaces and leads them on an investigation of the link between the Taelons and a biomedical facility's cloning operation.

programme.title: Earth: Final Conflict: Sins of the Father
programme.desc: A Senator's daughter is found to have kryss in her system. Liam and Renee suspect the Taelons lied about synthesizing it and there is a new location for production. They believe Federov is involved. Da'an is addicted to kryss.

programme.title: The Lost World: Out of the Blue
programme.desc: Marguerite, Roxton, and Challenger take the place of Askwith aboard his ghost ship and return to the day of its fatal departure in 1915. Back on the Plateau, Veronica chases down Askwith.

programme.title: The Lost World: The Travelers
programme.desc: Malone remains missing, and the explorers' search party crosses paths with a trio of travelers. Marguerite becomes taken with the dashing leader, especially when he offers her a way off the Plateau.

programme.title: The Lost World: Eye for an Eye
programme.desc: Roxton learns what it's like to be the hunted after he kills a Triceratops. Osina-a mystical, half-dinosaur guardian-puts a curse on him that makes him the target of a mysterious hunter.

programme.title: The Lost World: True Spirit
programme.desc: Veronica and Marguerite use a ouija board to communicate with Malone, who Veronica believes is trapped in a spirit realm. However, their attempt may have aroused the spirit of Saros, a dead warlord.

programme.title: The Lost World: The Knife
programme.desc: Malone's time in the spirit realm has given him psychic abilities. When he and Challenger discover a morbid campsite, Malone is encouraged to use his new powers to solve the case of Jack the Ripper.

programme.title: The Lost World: Fire in the Sky
programme.desc: A dying stranger issues a warning to three of the explorers, begging them to find a hunter named Pierson Rice. Roxton shares a common, painful past with the mysterious Rice.

programme.title: The Lost World: Dead Man's Hill
programme.desc: Roxton stumbles into a bizarre Wild West alternate reality when he finds his name on a tombstone. Roxton meets the other explorers' pioneer-town personas.

programme.title: The Lost World: Hollow Victory
programme.desc: Challenger experiments with a new fuel source in the hot-air balloon, and takes the other explorers along for a test ride. However, a storm drags the balloon into a dangerous underground world.

programme.title: The Lost World: A Witch's Calling
programme.desc: While Roxton and Malone search for the missing Veronica, two young witches lure them away from safety. Unbeknownst to the explorers, a sorceress and her disciples plot to destroy Challenger.

programme.title: The Lost World: Brothers in Arms
programme.desc: Malone is pierced by a poison dart from a Keeran blowdart. Under the influence of the hallucinogenic poison, Malone relives his nightmarish experience as a battlefield correspondent in WWI.

programme.title: The Lost World: Ice Age
programme.desc: A new Ice Age threatens the ecosystem. The explorers investigate the site of a meteor crash and try to help a woman. Not knowing who she is, they are targeted by her cold-blooded subjects.

programme.title: The Lost World: The End Game
programme.desc: The intractable Death comes to settle her score with Lord Roxton. In a series of games, Roxton plays Death in an attempt to keep his life, as well as the lives of his friends.

programme.title: The Lost World: Phantoms
programme.desc: Veronica is led by the sound of piano music into the arms of a lover from a bygone era. Ignoring Challenger's warnings about her involvement with him, she falls quickly for her new beau.

programme.title: The Lost World: The Secret
programme.desc: An assassin threatens the explorers, and Marguerite fears that he may be linked to her past and come to settle old scores. The secret she tries to bury creates a rift between herself and Roxton.

programme.title: The Lost World: Finn
programme.desc: An experiment with new energy sources goes awry, launching Roxton, Challenger, and Marguerite 100 years into the future. They discover that the rest of the world has been ravaged by war.

programme.title: The Lost World: Suspicion
programme.desc: Finn joins the explorers at the Treehouse. A team of archeologists suffer disease, violence, and distrust after opening an ancient urn that may have housed a demonic spirit.

programme.title: The Lost World: The Imposters
programme.desc: The explorers seek out a portal, but are overtaken by a force that replaces Marguerite, Roxton, and Challenger with three demons. With an age of chaos impending, Finn must bring back her friends.

programme.title: The Lost World: The Elixir
programme.desc: Challenger tests his nutritional elixir, but the drink causes hallucinations of his wife and younger self to appear in the treehouse. The others must find a cure before his visions become deadly.

programme.title: The Lost World: Tapestry
programme.desc: Challenger is taken captive by a WWI transport pilot guarding a crashed plane full of stolen iridium ingots. He, Roxton, and Marguerite relive their deepest secrets, each connected to the cargo.

programme.title: The Lost World: Legacy
programme.desc: An old enemy returns with a powerful artifact that could give him total power over the plateau. Veronica believes that her mother's pendant is leading her back to her parents.

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: It's the last day for Anita Manning to snatch the lead from James Lewis as they start in Woburn in Bedfordshire and end up at a gripping auction in Cirencester, Gloucestershire.
programme.sub-title: Anita Manning and James Lewis, Day 5

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: It's the first day for Charlie Ross and James Braxton to take to the road, and what a day it is! Their adventures start in the Highlands of Scotland in a small town called Cromarty and end in Buckie at a record-breaking auction showdown.
programme.sub-title: Charlie Ross and James Braxton, Day 1

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip

programme.title: Dog Soldiers
programme.desc: A routine military exercise turns into a nightmare in the Scotland wilderness.

programme.title: Nosferatu
programme.desc: Vampire Count Orlok expresses interest in a new residence and real estate agent Hutter's wife.

programme.title: Pluto TV Masters of Horror
programme.desc: Step into the shadows with Pluto TV Masters of Horror‚Äîa channel devoted to classic chills and timeless terror. Featuring legends like Peter Cushing, Christopher Lee, and John Carpenter, we celebrate the golden age of horror

programme.title: One Step Beyond: The Death Waltz
programme.desc: At a cavalry outpost in 1860s New Mexico, flirtatious, heartless Lillie takes great delight in playing her two beaus, decent Eustace Fairchild and the sexier, more dashing Henry Buchanan off against each other.

programme.title: One Step Beyond: Moment of Hate
programme.desc: A successful but driven businesswoman, Karen Wadsworth, is convinced that she can make her thoughts become reality. She soon begins to believe that she can use the power of suggestion and turn it into the power to kill.

programme.title: One Step Beyond: To Know the End
programme.desc: Emily MacDougall, a young woman living in England during World War II, begins to have strange hallucinations of death and destruction.

programme.title: One Step Beyond: The Trap
programme.desc: A young man discovers a strange parallel universe with dangerous repercussions.

programme.title: One Step Beyond: The Voice
programme.desc: Young reporter Jared Corning travels to a small New England town to cover the trial of several local people accused of setting fire to a barn owned by unpopular Tom Goss. Jared finds it hard to believe that their aim was to kill a pet raccoon.

programme.title: One Step Beyond: The Promise
programme.desc: Following the Second World War German ex-prisoner of war Carl Bremer remains in London, working on bomb disposal units. He marries a local woman and she is about to give birth to their child.

programme.title: One Step Beyond: Tonight at 12:17
programme.desc: Laura Perkins is expecting a baby, and the pregnancy is worrying her. She is soon shocked to discover, however, that her condition has resulted in her having extraordinary psychic powers.

programme.title: One Step Beyond: Where Are They?
programme.desc: In 1922 the town of Chico, California was pelted by rocks falling from an empty sky. A writer who called himself The Ghost took credit for the phenomena, but was never identified.

programme.title: One Step Beyond: Legacy of Love
programme.desc: Two people are drawn to a remote town and to each other without explanation.

programme.title: One Step Beyond: Rendezvous
programme.desc: A wife is notified that her husband, a Marine, has been lost at sea. However, she refuses to believe that he is dead and knows that he will return to her.

programme.title: One Step Beyond: The Executioner
programme.desc: In 1862, Confederate soldier Jess Bradley and his faithful dog are captured by a sadistic Union officer, Col. Martin. When Jess' dog is killed, forces from beyond began to take a strange revenge on the colonel.

programme.title: One Step Beyond: The Last Round
programme.desc: A prizefighter who has fallen on very hard times is visited by the ghost of a fellow boxer, who reminds him of a terrifying old legend that may well come true.

programme.title: One Step Beyond: Dead Man's Tale
programme.desc: A down-on-his-luck newsman, Phillip Werris, checks into a flea-bag hotel with his wife Jan, where he finds a manual on how to prospect for gold.

programme.title: One Step Beyond: The Sacred Mushroom
programme.desc: Newland and his associates visit a remote Mexican village to determine if eating a rare mushroom can enhance one's extrasensory perception capacities.

programme.title: One Step Beyond: The Gift
programme.desc: It's May in England and a Gypsy fortuneteller and her rakish son set to work rooking a gullible public. But when the phony fortuneteller actually receives the gift of clairvoyance she has long prayed for, she is startled by what she sees.

programme.title: One Step Beyond: Person Unknown
programme.desc: In Mexico, an escaped convict hides out in a monastery. Unfortunately, it is on the night when the ghost of an Aztec warrior is said to roam the halls. When a murder is discovered later that night, he must prove that he didn't commit the murder.

programme.title: One Step Beyond: Night of Decision
programme.desc: During the American Revolution, Gen. George Washington is suddenly visited by visions that convince him the revolution will be successful.

programme.title: One Step Beyond: The Stranger
programme.desc: Following an earthquake in Asia Minor three living people are dug out of the rubble. They claim that a fourth man, who has died, was the driving force who sustained their battle for survival, but finger prints reveal him to be a prisoner.

programme.title: One Step Beyond: Justice
programme.desc: A man confesses to murdering a child, but the members of his church swear that at the time of the killing the man was asleep in a pew.

programme.title: One Step Beyond: The Face
programme.desc: From early childhood Stephen Bolt has frightening dreams of a man's ominous face. Later he sees that the man's hand threatens him with a knife. Stephen knows the dreams are a premonition of his death, but his family are unsympathetic.

programme.title: The Burning
programme.desc: A mysterious man emerges from the Argentinean rainforest to help a poor farmer and his daughter, who are threatened by a band of mercenaries hired to force them to sell their land.

programme.title: The Gate
programme.desc: The removal of an old tree in Glen's backyard reveals a large and mysterious hole which leads to The Gate ‚Äì an underground chamber of terrifying demonic evil.

programme.title: Amityville 3-D
programme.desc: In this second sequel to 1979's THE AMITYVILLE HORROR, the infamous and dreaded Amityville house on Long Island is once again the centerpiece of terror when it is bought by a skeptical journalist.

programme.title: The Gate
programme.desc: The removal of an old tree in Glen's backyard reveals a large and mysterious hole which leads to The Gate ‚Äì an underground chamber of terrifying demonic evil.

programme.title: Slumber Party Massacre
programme.desc: A true horror cult classic! A high school student's slumber party turns terrifying as an escaped mental patient with a drill decides to crash the evening. Starring: Michelle Michaels, Robin Stille, Michael Villella

programme.desc: A confidence man is aided by the drovers and promptly shows his gratitude by stealing the ownership papers of the herd.

programme.desc: When John crashes Cab 804, the cabbies are shocked into a period of mourning, as they reminisce about the wild and memorable events that occurred when they were driving the legendary cab.

programme.title: 100 Years of Horror
programme.desc: King Kong¬ís Fay Wray is probably the most famous scream queen of the horror genre, but you¬íll be surprised to see who else made the list!

programme.title: 100 Years of Horror

programme.title: Relic Hunter: The Executioner's Mask
programme.desc: When a model's face is disfigured after she puts on the mask of a French executioner, Sydney and Nigel will try and find the tomb to reverse the curse.

programme.title: Relic Hunter: The Royal Ring
programme.desc: When the British Museum gets Sidney and Nigel to help search at Tudor sites for a ring of King Henry VIII, Nigel is confronted with his self-confident pestering elder brother Preston Bailey.

programme.title: Relic Hunter: Set in Stone
programme.desc: In a monastery, Knight Gabriel impales a demon, which then turns to stone. In 2001, Nigel and Sydney arrive bearing a letter from a monk, but the abbot claims it is a forgery and shuts them out.
